mission.name: Security Blanket
mission.desc: Yuriel prepares the spell, while Freya waits impatiently...

line.text: Can you see a good entry point to the goblin kingdom?
The city looks different from the last time I saw it. Its security has been fortified, so it will be harder to sneak in.
Outside the city, I can see some goblins working on the walls...
That will be the best place to start.

mission.name: Spy Watch
mission.desc: Freya leaves for her journey to the goblin kingdom. With the knowledge from the looking-glass spell, she heads towards the weakest point in their defenses.

mission.name: Gift from Beetleton
mission.desc: A troop of goblins circles the kingdom's perimeter. One of them has the Spellstone hammer from Beetleton Bunker. Freya sneaks closer.

line.text: That hammer... it's a legendary artifact from Beetleton Bunker. The goblins stole it already?
Hey guys, there's a hole 'n the exterior o'er here. Why don' you give it a whack with that fancy hammer.
If you insist, Cap'n! But let's hurry back to the tower soon, it's too hot out here for this kinda work!

mission.name: Upkeep
mission.desc: The goblins get to the edge of the perimeter. The goblin carrying the hammer takes out a schematic of the watch tower, laying it on the ground...

line.text: This is the spot, boys. Boss wants the watch tower right here.

mission.name: Automated System
mission.desc: The goblins swing the hammer at the schematic. Freya watches the artifact's magic: a watchtower grows from the ground. With just a few swings of the hammer, a huge watchtower has been built.

mission.name: Break Time
mission.desc: The goblins rejoice at the Spellstone hammer's power. Wiping their brows, they rest under the newly-formed tower.

line.text: I'm lovin' this hammer! It only took a few swings of it, and a whole watchtower grew up from the ground!
Now we finally have somewhere to escape the heat.
If you think the heat here is bad, just wait 'til we get to the Salt Wastes. You'll be sweatin' bullets.
Eh, that's if we get far enough without gettin' chomped on by those darned dragons, first!

mission.name: Red Handed
mission.desc: Freya has gotten the information she needed. As she turns to leave, she bumps straight into a goblin!

line.text: Who the in the bloody fire pit are you?!
Oh, ahh I'm the new gardener. They needed someone to cut the real high branches.
You don't say! I always thought there was a lot of landscaping potential around here! Hey guys! Have you met the new gardener?
You idiot! She's not a gardener, she's a spy! Get 'em!

mission.name: Back Home
mission.desc: Freya managed to make her way back to Skyhaven. She quickly finds Yuriel and relays her findings.

mission.name: Bad News
mission.desc: Yuriel is surprised to hear that the goblins intend to take the Salt Wastes. Even with the power of the hammer, the Salt Wastes are a difficult environment to inhabit.

mission.name: Ancient History
mission.desc: Yuriel has been searching through his books for hours. At last, he finds what he's been looking for. An ancient book about the history of the Salt Wastes.

mission.name: Dragon Breeding Ground
mission.desc: The book notes the unusual weather of the wastes. There are months where the sun does not set and temperature is scorching hot. Surely not a comfortable environment for goblins, but perhaps dragons?

mission.name: Royal Report
mission.desc: Yuriel is starting to see the goblins' plan. Even Skyhaven could be in danger if the goblins team up further with dragons. Yuriel rushes to report his findings to the Queen...

line.text: Yuriel, you have returned quickly. What have you found?
The goblins are expanding their territory into the Salt Wastes. There, they plan to breed dragons. They're building an entire army!
Such a foolhardy plan. Yet if it works, the dragons could pose a serious threat to Skyhaven.

mission.name: Backup has Arrived
mission.desc: The Queen eagerly awaits for Yuriel's report. She has her guard quickly usher him into her quarters.

line.text: Even so, the Wastes will be difficult terrain for our army. We shouldn't handle this threat alone.
Just what I was thinking, my Queen. I brought along an old friend of mine. He can help us through the Wastes.
Why hello there Queenie, the name's Hexfist!

mission.name: Long Live the King
mission.desc: Goblins throw the schematics of a throne on the floor. With a few strikes of the Spellstone Hammer, the final piece of the goblins' Salt Waste fortress has been completed.

line.text: Well done boys! This place don't look too shabby! Tonight we shall celebrate the goblins' claim of the Salt Wastes!

mission.name: The King of Con Artists
mission.desc: Conquering the Salt Wastes is just the beginning of the goblins' plans. Reks plots with his general about the next step of expanding the Goblin Empire...

line.text: Dormic, my dearest general, may I have a word with you?
Of course, my King.
We need to talk about our next step. A peasant or two might be upset that we squashed their village to build this fine fortress.
They're just jealous of our toys! Dispose of 'em before they think of stealin' our dragons.

mission.name: Pipe Dreams
mission.desc: The goblins dream of even more power. Departing from the throne room, the general gathers his troops.

mission.name: Glory Earned
mission.desc: Reks moves to the balcony in the fortress, seeing the outside expanse of the Salt Wastes. Soon the entire world will know of the goblins' might, when they claim the home they have always deserved.

mission.name: Locked Up Tight
mission.desc: The army prepares to depart. Reks entrusts a valuable artifact to his servant.

line.text: Now, before we depart. Servant, I need you to take this Hammer and keep it in the vault.
If you so much as get a scratch on it, it will be your head, ya understand?
Yes, my King.

mission.name: Knock Knock
mission.desc: A lone orc approaches the goblin fortress. His hands are held up as if in surrender. The guards take no chances, aiming their bows at the stranger, in case he makes one false move...

line.text: Howdy, neighbors! Just droppin' by, wanted t' give ya a warm welcome in our neighborhood. Ya can put those fancy lookin' arrows down if ya want.
Go away, orc! Unless you've brought us a pitcher of cool water, we don't care what you want!
Come now, friends. I mean no harm. I've got nothin' against new neighbors.
If you promise to leave my tribe in peace, I can show you a thing or two about the Salt Wastes.

mission.name: Hot Deals
mission.desc: The guards give each other quizzical looks. As sweat pours from their brows, they take a few moments to discuss the situation.

mission.name: Behind Enemy Lines
mission.desc: The goblins agree to let Orgoth through the fortress gates. He is amazed at the fort's details, especially since it had been constructed so quickly. The guards usher him quickly to the King.

line.text: King Reks! A pleasure t' finally meet ya.
Guards! Why have you let this orc buffoon into the fortress?! Get him outta here!
For good reason, your Majesty. Since we're neighbors an' all, it'd be best for us to work together.
Ya got quite the army outside. You sure you know your way around the Salt Wastes? The land can be tricky...

mission.name: Around the War Table
mission.desc: Our heroes are gathered in the airship. They discuss their strategy against the growing goblin threat. Allies from all over the continent where goblins have caused trouble have shown up to lend their aid.

line.text: The goblins will surely make a move soon. We require more forces to ensure our victory.
We've already gathered a small army. Where would we find more forces?
We can ask for the strength of the elementals. However, I'm unsure which tribe would help us...

mission.name: Between Worlds
mission.desc: Rayne tries to come up with a plan. Elementals rarely intervene in mortals' wars. Convincing them to fight against the goblins will be difficult.

mission.name: Looking for Backup
mission.desc: Rayne takes out a map of Arcantica. She closely examines the terrain the goblins plan to invade...

line.text: The goblins have constructed their fortress near a tribe of earth elementals. With their own home in danger, the earth elementals may be willing to help us.

mission.name: In the Dirt and Gravel
mission.desc: Rayne arrives in the Salt Wastes. She stands a few miles away from the goblin fortress, in an area they are expanding toward.

line.text: Now, where are these ground elementals hiding?

mission.name: Friends in Low Places
mission.desc: Rayne examines the ground. She remembers hearing of a tribe of ground elementals that has made the Salt Wastes their home. If she can find them, they might lend their power against the goblins.

mission.name: Cowlick Tuft
mission.desc: An unusual tuft of grass sits on the ground. Noticing it, Rayne approaches and gives the patch a hardy scratch ...the ground rumbles.

line.text: Who gives Milton head scratches!
Ahh greetings Milton, I did not mean to disturb you. Unfortunately I come with grave news about your new neighbors...

mission.name: Hard Choices
mission.desc: Milton looks annoyed with the thought of having goblins build a fortress on top of his grass tuft. Then again, he has heard the mud pits of Dawnglow are particularly cozy this time of year...

mission.name: Grounding Reality
mission.desc: Rayne can see the ground elemental pondering her warning. She decides to explain further about the events of Beetleton Bunker.

line.text: Goblins you say? Ehh, those creatures make for messy neighbors. Big smelly piles of garbage everywhere.
Milton cannot risk living so close to such smells. I will see what my tribe can do for you...

mission.name: Through the Valley
mission.desc: Reks has assembled his army. They lay low on their way to Tarragon Peak, moving towards the valley Orgoth has advised.

line.text: This path has good protection, Reks. It should cover your army into the north.
Very well, 'neighbor'... but let me warn you: if there is anything funny on this route you won't make it back to your tribe.
GUARD! Put the orc under close watch.

mission.name: Safe from Danger
mission.desc: The valley proves to be a safe route of passage. Most of the monsters that lurk the Salt Wastes avoid the valley path.

mission.name: Sun Burned
mission.desc: The day has drawn on. This route is considerably longer than the original plan. Reks's troops grow tired in the sun.

line.text: How much longer 'til we reach Tarragon Peak?! The sun is starting to wear down my men.
Just past the next bend, my King.

mission.name: Around the Bend
mission.desc: The army begins to round the last bend of the valley. A welcoming party of dragons and heroes sits waiting for their arrival.

line.text: Well well, come back for another visit old friend? I wish you had given me more warning!
Typical orc treachery! Why'd I even listen to you?!
GUARD! Call in the air troops!

mission.name: Saved from Disgrace
mission.desc: Fiona looks up in surprise when dragons descend from the clouds. Reks sneers at Fiona; as if he'd be so easily fooled!

line.text: You know what they say. Never travel without a backup dragon guard. Sorry tamer, you have been outmatched this time.
But perhaps, if you ask real nice, I can confiscate your dragons and let you go on your way.
That's cute, you think I didn't come without a few tricks of my own?

mission.name: Rain from Above
mission.desc: Angels and Ground Elementals emerge from the cracks in the valley. Barrages of arrows and rocks fall on the Goblin forces.

line.text: Ah, not bad puddin, teamin' up with the angels like this. Hah! Let's see what they can do against my dragons.
Well lucky for you I am just full of surprises today! Dilbert! Unleash the catapults!
Just finished building them! Alight, here we go!

mission.name: Off Guard
mission.desc: Reks swoops his dragon through the valley. In a fluster, he grabs his war horn and signals to his army. It's time for an all out attack!

mission.name: Last Stand
mission.desc: Reks, now furious with the turn of events, charges at Fiona and her dragons in a full on assault. He will not give up on the expansion of the goblin empire so easily!

line.text: HE HAS THE HAMMER?! Servant, I told you to store it in the vault!
Sorry, my King...
Looks like I lost it along with my mask.
Whaaaat?! You're no goblin! I've been tricked!

mission.name: Starlight, Starbright
mission.desc: Malchior and Tarian return to the strange building that mysteriously appeared near The Void. Malchior waves a glass bottle around frantically, trying to capture as many Will-O-Wisps as he can.

line.text: Bright wight, bright light, be contained by my glass prison's might!
Yes, do continue. I'll fend off the monsters while you play hopscotch.

mission.name: Strength in Numbers
mission.desc: Tarian continues to fight the monsters while Malchior concentrates on his research. The wisps melt together into Malchior's bottle, seeming to form a single mass.

line.text: Isn't this exciting? These little bugger flames actually seem to repel the energies of The Void.
If we find their source, we might learn something to combat The Void's power.

mission.name: Undead Assault
mission.desc: Undead roam the area, preying on unsuspecting travelers. Tarian fights them off while Malchior collects Will-O-Wisps.

mission.name: Hate of the Light
mission.desc: The monsters are attracted to the light, trying desperately to reach Malchior and his bottle of wisps.

mission.name: Residence of the Haunted
mission.desc: The two follow the trail to the mysterious building. They pass rows of gravestones on the path. Light shines from inside the building's windows.

line.text: Look at how the light converges on that shack. Fascinating. Closer, Tarian! We must get closer!
Yes, yes.

mission.name: Wrong Enemy
mission.desc: Malchior and Tarian find that another group has already reached the shack's entrance. They are wearing clothes and cloaks like adventurers.

line.text: Blast... more Undead! Don't let 'em get through!
Don't stare. It's rude.

mission.name: Tarian's Offer
mission.desc: The adventurers are panicked by Tarian's appearance. Tarian tries to reason with the adventurers.

line.text: Stand down or face our wrath.

mission.name: Malchior's Offer
mission.desc: Tarian's threat has only worked the adventurers into a greater frenzy. Malchior tries to reason with the adventurers on his friend's behalf.

line.text: Stand aside, Tarian, I'll handle negotiations.
CEASE YOUR STRUGGLES OR PERISH IN FIRE!
Oh dear. They still appear to desire the fight.

mission.name: The Fallen Aether Leader
mission.desc: The adventurers have been defeated, when a familiar face intervenes...

line.text: ENOUGH!
Samael? What are you doing here?!

mission.name: Single Purpose
mission.desc: Samael explains that he had originally hired the adventurers. He also explains his true purpose for coming out to such a desolate area.

line.text: This place reeks of The Void. I shall dismantle its power before some fool seeks to harness it.
Now... what is your purpose here?
We're here to harness the power of The Void!
Malchior!!

mission.name: Dangerous Power
mission.desc: Samael is furious that Malchior and Tarian are researching ways to use The Void.

line.text: I would expect no less idiocy from agents of Chaos.
Men, eliminate these fools! I shall find the source where The Void's power emanates, and destroy it myself!

mission.name: High Stakes
mission.desc: After dispatching Samael's guard, Malchior and Tarian enter the shack. They must search quickly if they are to find the source of The Void's power before Samael.

mission.name: Fight Your Way Through
mission.desc: The inside of the building is filled with Undead. Malchior and Tarian must fight their way through.

mission.name: A Familiar Face
mission.desc: Malchior spots a gigantic Spellstone, laced with black magic. Before they can get closer, Malchior and Tarian encounter another unexpected guest...

line.text: Over here! This is no ordinary Spellstone. Look at those odd tendrils of magic around it - it must be the medium for The Void's power.
Well well well... What do we have here, MORE foolish adventurers?!

mission.name: General Garrick
mission.desc: Tarian recognizes their assailant as one of his own men. The other had disappeared some time ago. Yet the man doesn't seem to recognize Tarian...

line.text: General Garrick?! I thought you were dead!
You know the man?
When The Void first appeared, I sent him to investigate. I haven't seen him in months.

mission.name: Lost Sanity
mission.desc: The Chaos general fights recklessly, with Undead joining his struggle against Tarian and Malchior.

line.text: You have no idea what you're dealing with!
Look at how the Void Spellstone's power reaches towards him... He's being possessed!
Not for long...

mission.name: Found Sanity
mission.desc: Malchior sprinkles the Will-O-Wisps' essence upon the Chaos general.

line.text: What...? Where am I?
You've done it. He's returning to his senses.

mission.name: Reformed Resolve
mission.desc: General Garrick joins Tarian and Malchior, pledging to stop The Void once more.

line.text: I'm so sorry, Lord Tarian. What can I do to make this up to you?
Rise up and prepare to fight against The Void once more.

mission.name: The Void Spellstone
mission.desc: With General Garrick's sanity returned, the group returns its attention to the odd Spellstone. There must be some kind of secret for them to unlock!

mission.name: Not One More Step
mission.desc: Before the group can study the Spellstone further, Samael interrupts!

line.text: Stand aside, all of you! That Spellstone is made of pure evil.
Not one step closer, sir. Lord Tarian needs space to observe the stone.
You... I remember you, you're possessed by The Void!

mission.name: A Matter of Trust
mission.desc: Tarian and Malchior trust that General Garrick has returned to his senses. However, Samael fears that the presence of The Void might spread.

mission.name: Judgement
mission.desc: General Garrick worries he is vulnerable to The Void's influence.

line.text: Lord Samael is right. The Void could still be inside my mind. Let me take responsibility.
We did not save you just so you could die!
I will destroy him and The Void's power source!!

mission.name: Chain Reaction
mission.desc: Samael's power is great. He unleashes an attack so powerful that it ruptures the Void Spellstone in a great burst of light!

line.text: It is done. I have clipped the influence of The Void in this region.
No, a chain reaction has started! Everyone, watch out!

mission.name: Hero's Sacrifice
mission.desc: The Spellstone breaks to reveal a creature of horrible might. It slams Samael aside with one sweep of its claws, before turning against the group...

line.text: UWRAAAAARGH!
Lord Tarian, please take the Aether leader and your friend to safety. I will stay behind and fight this foe.

mission.name: Nomadic Travels
mission.desc: Decim has wandered across the lands, searching for a baby dragon of his own. During his travels, he comes across Goblin Rise Stronghold, in the Goblin Kingdom.

line.text: Whoa, all the people here are so GREEN! Don't they get enough sunlight?!
Wait... What's that?!

mission.name: Uncontainable Curiousity
mission.desc: Decim has noticed something behind one of the huts. He hops over a fence that says 'do not enter' in order to get closer...

mission.name: The Sparkler Fireworks
mission.desc: Behind the hut is some kind of scrapyard for junk. Decim digs through metal scraps, until he finds what he spotted earlier...

line.text: Are these... fireworks? Sweet, I love explosions!
Oy, this's private property! Whaddya think yer doin'?

mission.name: Pretty Lights
mission.desc: Decim tries to grab as many fireworks as he can. Unfortunately his fire powers burn out of control, accidentally lighting the fuses. In a wake of explosions, the entire straw hut catches on fire!

line.text: Guards, guuuards! This man's trying to destroy my property!
Hey, relax! It's just some pretty lights that uh, might be burning your house down.
It was an accident, okay?!

mission.name: Halt, Criminal Scum!
mission.desc: The goblin guards arrive, responding to the commotion that Decim has caused. Decim is in big trouble...

line.text: Halt! Sir, you're going to need to come with us.
Nooo.... Not again! It's not my fault!

mission.name: One Star Service
mission.desc: The guards have locked Decim away in the prison depths of Goblin Rise Stronghold. Decim sits in a cell, the lone inhabitant of the dungeon, and mourns his fate.

line.text: Only one piece of moldy bread and a cup of water? They didn't even put a mint under my pillow! This is unacceptable!

mission.name: Uncontainable
mission.desc: Decim grabs the bars and shouts to be let free. Then he remembers that he still has some firework sparklers. He lights a few and holds them against the metal to try and melt them... Only to notice that one of the bars is rusted and he can pull it open.

mission.name: The Great Escape
mission.desc: The dungeon is dark, but Decim continues on. A few stray beasts block his path, but Decim will not be stopped.

mission.name: Metal Gear Dragon
mission.desc: While trying to find his way out, Decim hears a strange noise in one of the cells. Peering inside, Decim sees something unbelievable.

line.text: Is that... A baby dragon?! Hang on buddy, I'll get you out of there!
Ch-ch-ch!

mission.name: Gears and Steel
mission.desc: The 'baby dragon' is unlike anything Decim has seen. Instead of scales, it seems to be made of gears and steel. Whenever Decim tries to get close to them, they snap with their metal jaws.

line.text: CALM DOWN BUDDY!
What's got you so upset, huh? Oh hey, looks like more of your friends are still trapped. I'll set 'em all free!

mission.name: Prison Break
mission.desc: Decim has freed a whole host of mechanical dragonlings. The commotion attracts the goblin guards, but the wind-up dragons stampede towards freedom. Decim gets swept up with them, still struggling to escape!

line.text: What's going on here?! What are you doing here!?
Look out, little buddies! I'll protect you!

mission.name: Relentless Guards
mission.desc: Decim has escaped the prison complex with his new friends, but still needs to find a way out of Goblin Rise Stronghold. He looks around wildly for a place to escape, while fighting off the goblin guards...

mission.name: The Creator
mission.desc: While looking for an exit, Decim and his new friends come face to face with guard goblins and a familiar enemy...

line.text: You! What are you doing with my creations?!

mission.name: Freedom or Death
mission.desc: Decim tries to reason with the angry goblin. There seems to be some misunderstanding about the nature of Decim's 'friend.'

line.text: Your creations? These dragonlings were locked away in the dungeon. They must be set free!

mission.name: Dangerous Origins
mission.desc: Decim tries to herd the mechanical dragonlings away from the angry goblins. Escaping with an entire pack of them will be difficult...

line.text: Those things were locked away because they're so dangerous, but I didn't have the heart to destroy them. Please, you must listen to me and return them.
FREEDOM!

mission.name: Final Push
mission.desc: Decim realizes that the mechanical dragonlings seem to be attracted by the sparkler's light! He waves the light around frantically, orchestrating the wind-up creatures to follow him.

line.text: This nonsense has gone on long enough. Yer comin' back with us!

mission.name: Termite Double Dragons
mission.desc: The wind-up dragonlings run straight against the stronghold's wall, their metal jaws chomping through the wood. The guards are unable to stop Decim or the creations.

line.text: We did it! I don't suppose one of you baby dragonlings wants to stick around and be MY dragon, would you?
Owch! Ow, okay, I get it!

mission.name: Surprise Attack
mission.desc: Decim has a clear shot of running away, when he hears a cry of alarm behind him. Turning around, he sees a pack of Undead has wandered into Goblin Rise Stronghold!

mission.name: A Mentor's Wisdom
mission.desc: Decim abandons his original escape plan, moving back to the stronghold. The goblins need his help! He remembers the teachings of his mentor, that he should help those in need and maintain a clear focus...

line.text: Somebody, help!
Ugh. If I leave now, Rayne will never let me hear the end of it...
Hang on, I'm coming!

mission.name: Undead Resurrection
mission.desc: Each time an Undead falls, another one rises to take its place. Decim fights fiercely, blasting each returning Undead with more fireballs...

mission.name: Crispy Undead
mission.desc: Decim now fights side by side with the goblins, trying to defend them from the mindless Undead. Their numbers are beginning to finally thin.

line.text: You came back... to save me?
Yeah whatever! I just was in the mood for barbecue and small fry!

mission.name: Undead Pack Master
mission.desc: The Undead are nearly defeated, when a horrible monster emerges from the rest of the pack...

line.text: Raaaaawr!
Yikes, looks like it's boss time!

mission.name: Negotiations
mission.desc: With the rest of the Undead gone, the threat has vanished from Goblin Rise Stronghold. With the immediate threat gone, the goblin guards surround Decim...

mission.name: Friends Forever
mission.desc: The goblins stare at Decim, but the mechanic goblin comes to his aid. It seems like Rayne's teachings might have turned out to be worthwhile after all.

line.text: You saved me... saved all of us! I'm sorry, I misjudged you.
Aye, you're welcome in our stronghold anytime, lad.
Cool, but all I wanted was a baby dragon. Hey little guy, why don't you come with m-
CHOMP
OWCH, OW, STOP!

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: When Decim first arrives at Goblin Rise Stronghold, he tells the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. However, he met a tragic end when his rivals played an unfair trick upon him.

line.text: ...And whoever dares say Pumpking's name will meet with the King himself, who judges with either treats or tricks!
Aieee! So scary, so scary! We'll never speak his name!

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance
mission.desc: The goblin children depart from Decim. Decim laughs at the children's reaction to his story, until he notices that he's not alone...

line.text: Haha, what a bunch of suckers! Who'd believe a stupid legend like THAT?
Who... Who are you?! Stay back!

mission.name: More Treat Than Trick
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays something by Decim's feet, before turning and fading into the night...

line.text: OH MAN!
...Wait, did he leave this pumpkin filled with candy? Sweet, what a cool guy!

mission.name: Triumphant Return
mission.desc: Decim has returned to Tarragon Peak after his adventure in Goblin Rise Stronghold. For the first time, he was able to make friends with a dragon, and he can't wait to tell the residents of Tarragon Peak.

line.text: That dragon tamer said I'd never be able to care for my own dragon... HA!
I can't wait to tell her all about the dragon friends I made in the Goblin Kingdom!

mission.name: The Way of the Wyverns
mission.desc: When Decim returns to Wyverns' Way, he finds that the sanctuary has been damaged. Parts of the building have crumbled, and there are suspicious scorch marks on the ground...

mission.name: Silent Sanctuary
mission.desc: Decim frantically looks for any signs of life. Just a few days ago, Wyverns' Way was a haven for dragons who had bonded with humans. Now, it is completely deserted.

line.text: What happened, and why is everything destroyed? Where is everyone?!
Look, one of the guardians is still here! Get 'im!

mission.name: See No Evil
mission.desc: Decim defends himself against the goblins, but doesn't understand why they would attack him in the first place. He tries to reason with them...

line.text: I'm not a sanctuary guardian! I'm just passing through!
Oy, so ya don't care what happens to the dragons? Pass on through, lad.
...What are you doing to the dragons?

mission.name: Be Free
mission.desc: The goblins show Decim the remnants of cracked dragon eggs, and a line of fettered dragons. As the goblins explain their plan, Decim becomes filled with an unquenchable fury...

line.text: These dragons belong to us, see. We'll train 'em up right and proper to serve us.
...You seriously think you can kidnap dragons and get away with it? I'll break all their chains... I'LL FREE ALL THE DRAGONS!

mission.name: Misplaced Suspicion
mission.desc: The goblins disband, leaving Decim to free the dragons. However, the dragons have become more feral than what Decim anticipated...

line.text: Just a moment, guys. I'll get you out of here in no time.
Grrr.....

mission.name: Feral Dragons
mission.desc: Decim tries to remove the chains from the dragons, but they behave like wild beasts. Decim refuses to give up, even if the dragons don't understand that he wants to help them.

mission.name: The Wind Drake
mission.desc: At last Decim finishes removing the bindings. The dragons scatter the moment they're free. All have left... except one.

line.text: There ya go, dragon buddies!
Oh hey, one of the dragons stayed behind, but he looks a little scared...
*whimper*

mission.name: Dusty Scales
mission.desc: Decim cautiously approaches the remaining young dragon. A light film of grime has covered its scales.

line.text: What's this chalky dust over your scales? Are ya doing okay, little dragon?

mission.name: Pantomime
mission.desc: The drake moves a few paces ahead, then pauses to look at Decim. It moves again a little farther, looking back again. Decim guesses it wants to be followed, and moves after it.

mission.name: Dragon Fury
mission.desc: The drake has taken Decim to a thin river, one of the few sources of water on Tarragon Peak. However the water level has fallen even further, with a strange black grime coating the edges of the river bank.

line.text: This river is what you wanted to show me, dragon buddy?
RAAAWR!
Yikes, look out!

mission.name: Connect the Dots
mission.desc: The feral dragon flies away, leaving Decim and the wind drake alone at the riverbed. Decim investigates again...

line.text: This black grain by the river is gross. My hand burns just from touching it!
...Awoo...
Wait... is this the stuff stuck on your scales?!

mission.name: A Friend in Need
mission.desc: Decim realizes that his new dragon friend must be in pain. Although he doesn't know how to help, Decim is determined to do so.

line.text: Ugh, we need water to clean off your scales, but this river's all mucked up.
C'mon buddy, if we follow it a bit further down, maybe the water will clear up.

mission.name: Mysterious Corruption
mission.desc: Decim and his drake friend follow the river's path. The farther they get, the trickle of water slowly starts to increase. Decim can only hope the strange corruption disappears further down.

mission.name: Spreading Corruption
mission.desc: Monsters sometimes block the two's path. Decim notices that they also are covered in the strange grime. Whatever infected the river has also spread through the wildlife...

mission.name: Polluted Water
mission.desc: Decim and the drake are not having much luck by following the river. In fact, Decim is starting to wonder if they chose the wrong direction...

line.text: Geez, is the water getting WORSE? This is absolutely disgusting!

mission.name: Pursuers
mission.desc: Decim and the drake have traveled far, but not all the goblins are content to leave the two in peace. Behind them, goblins have pursued fiercely...

line.text: There's the lad that stole our dragons! Get 'em!

mission.name: Rematch
mission.desc: An entire troop of goblins have caught up with Decim and the drake! But Decim will not let them take the drake back into captivity...

mission.name: A Friend to Protect
mission.desc: Decim stands between the goblins and the sailing drake. Until one side loses, neither will back down...

line.text: Just get lost already! You're not taking him back!
Grrr!

mission.name: Dragon Guard
mission.desc: Despite being outnumbered, Decim and the drake fight valiantly against the goblins. They unleash a troop of dragons against them!

mission.name: Limited Strength
mission.desc: Each time Decim defeats one of the goblins or dragons, another one seems to take its place. Decim and his ally are starting to get tired...

line.text: ...Awoo...
Yer lookin' a wee bit tired, lad. Jus' give up!

mission.name: Confronting Defeat
mission.desc: It's becoming increasingly clear that Decim cannot fight off all the goblins by himself. He must prepare for the worst case scenario...

line.text: Buddy, I'm going to make one final push. Use that time to get away from here!

mission.name: But It Refused...
mission.desc: Against Decim's wishes, the drake remains by his side. The goblins send one of their fiercest dragons against them...

mission.name: Savior or Destroyer?
mission.desc: When all hope seems lost, the river swells up as if it has its own will. The waves wash over the battlefield, breaking up the combatants. Once the water recedes, a new figure stands before Decim...

line.text: WHOA! What was that?!

mission.name: Love of a Mother
mission.desc: Cedric and Ursurio leave the Avian territory, heading back to Golden Crown, to return Frobert to his home. The Mayor of Golden Crown is overjoyed to have her son back.

line.text: Oh Frobert, my son, you are unharmed!
Cedric, you saved my child, just as I knew you would. No matter how far you travel, you will always be Golden Crown's hero.

mission.name: Second Celebration
mission.desc: The frogs are prepared to hold a feast all over again, to celebrate the safe return of Frobert. However, Cedric insists that they must be on their way, despite Ursurio's temptation to stay.

mission.name: Original Purpose
mission.desc: Cedric reminds the Golden Crown leader their original mission for coming there. The citizens of Dawnglow watch tearfully as their hero prepares to leave on his journey.

line.text: All in the line of duty, Mayor. Now, didn't you have a final mission for me?
Does it involve more banquets?

mission.name: Secrets
mission.desc: The Golden Crown Mayor bites her lip anxiously. She looks around secretively, as if making sure no one else will hear her words.

mission.name: Final Request
mission.desc: When she has confirmed that only trusted ears will hear the information, the Mayor reveals her final mission to Cedric. Ursurio has promised to help as well, on the condition that Cedric will join their party on the airship.

line.text: Our neighbor settlement has reported unusual activity. They say other frogs are assaulting their comrades!
Leave it to us, ma'am. We'll look into it before I start my quest against The Void.

mission.name: On the Road
mission.desc: Ursurio travels with Cedric to the settlement that the Golden Crown Mayor had described. The road there is peaceful, with only a stray monster or two.

mission.name: Frog Civil War
mission.desc: When they reach the settlement, they can see immediate strife. Oddly-colored frogs assault the other residents. The assailants don't have the same look as the native Golden Crown frogs...

line.text: Foolish Goldie frogs! We'll show you how a Dawnglow fights!

mission.name: To the Rescue
mission.desc: Cedric and Ursurio rush to save the fleeing frogs. The attackers are merciless, despite both sides being frogs.

line.text: Heeeelp!
Don't worry, you're safe now. We won't let them hurt you.
Or eat you!

mission.name: Dawnglow Frenzy
mission.desc: Ursurio realizes that the attacking frogs are familiar. He tries to quell the enemies' desire to fight...

line.text: I have been to Dawnglow and know the frogs there are very kind. What's gotten into you?
Destroy... destroy...!

mission.name: Mad Frogs
mission.desc: The Dawnglow frogs claw at everything like madmen. Most Golden Crown frogs have hidden away in their homes. Cedric and Ursurio fight the enemies alone.

mission.name: Unfamiliar Battleground
mission.desc: Cedric is unfamiliar with how The Void's influence works, but Ursurio can spot the telltale signs. They will need to quell the angry frogs before they can focus on the corruption's source.

line.text: Do you see the dark energy around them, Cedric? This is more work of The Void.
This is my homeland. I won't allow this corruption any longer!

mission.name: No Rest
mission.desc: The frogs have slowed down their attacks, but Cedric and Ursurio are at a stalemate. They cannot kill innocent corrupted frogs, yet whenever one regains their consciousness, they simply resume their attacks.

line.text: This is endless!
Let's look for the source of the corruption. If we stop that, they should be free from its influence.

mission.name: Previous Experience
mission.desc: Ursurio tries to remember information from his time in Dawnglow. It could be key to solving their current dilemma.

line.text: You said you were in Dawnglow. Did you learn anything there that might help us?
Crayfish!
I mean... Yes, Groc and I found that the swamp water carried The Void's corruption.

mission.name: Water Corruption
mission.desc: Ursurio and Cedric begin searching for sources of water. The swamplands of Dawnglow connect directly to Golden Crown, so the corruption could have traveled through the canals.

mission.name: From Dawn to Gold
mission.desc: The two find the river that connects to Dawnglow. Black specks of The Void's energy float through the waters. The corruption has clearly spread from Dawnglow and into Golden Crown...

line.text: Surely the river wasn't always this polluted. It must be what's caused the Dawnglow frogs to go mad.
The same fate might await the Golden Crown frogs... We must act quickly!

mission.name: From the Depths
mission.desc: As Cedric and Ursurio get closer to the waters, something emerges from its depths! It is coated in the same black grime that has polluted the river...

mission.name: Swamp Fiends
mission.desc: Strange creatures emerge from the waters. Each one is covered in the black grime, glowing with dark energy from The Void...

mission.name: Mindless Aggression
mission.desc: The creatures fight with a strange tenacity. They don't flinch even when hit, continuing forward with nearly an Undead-like mentality.

mission.name: Boiling Water
mission.desc: With the monsters cleared out of the way, Cedric puts his hand into the river. It burns unnaturally, as if the water has somehow become like magma.

line.text: Owch! Don't touch the black dust in the river, got it...
Let's follow the river further. We might be able to cut it off at its source.

mission.name: The Plan
mission.desc: The river twists and turns, leading the two closer to the border of Dawnglow swamp. They find a particularly narrow spot of the river where the pollution seems to have bottlenecked.

line.text: This place has the worst pollution. If we can do something with the river here, it should prevent the corruption from controlling the Dawnglow frogs.

mission.name: Resistance
mission.desc: From the Dawnglow-Golden Crown divide, monsters pour out from the water. They can sense that Cedric and Ursurio have come to stop The Void...

mission.name: Futility
mission.desc: The two continue their fight against the corrupted frogs. The flow of enemies continues...

line.text: There are so many of them! How will we cleanse The Void's corruption?
We can't.

mission.name: Second Thoughts
mission.desc: Cedric might be a seasoned warrior, but he is still new against fighting The Void. Yet only magical items can completely cleanse The Void's corruption. Ursurio and Cedric possess no such artifacts.

line.text: What do you mean, we can't cleanse the corruption?! Then why are we here?

mission.name: The Bear and the Boulder
mission.desc: Ursurio lifts a boulder nearly twice his own size! With a great heave, he hurls it onto the divide between Dawnglow and Golden Crown!

line.text: We will simply block off the river instead. Watch my back; I'll block it off with this giant boulder.
RAAAAWR!

mission.name: Bah
mission.desc: It's the time of year where everyone gives presents, sings songs, and wears silly red hats. Samael can't understand what enjoyment people get from the holiday.

line.text: Jingle, jingle, deck the halls~
This incessant noise is giving me a headache.
Hey angel wings! Where's your hat?
Bah! Away from me, merry fools!

mission.name: Ghost of the Past
mission.desc: The celebrating frogs flee from the cranky angel. Samael sulks over the flippant attitude of the frogs, until a mysterious presence appears before him...

line.text: Samael...
Who - who's there?!
I am a ghost of the past. And there is a lesson you must learn...

mission.name: Ghost of the Present
mission.desc: The talking dragon vanishes, leaving Samael confused and alone. He's unsure what lesson he was supposed to have learned. While contemplating the Drake's appearance, a different figure appears...

line.text: Samael...
Another spirit? What is it this time?
I am a ghost of the present. And there is a lesson you must learn...

mission.name: Ghost of the Future
mission.desc: The frog vanishes, leaving Samael alone again. He contemplates the meaning of the spirits' appearances. Then, another spirit appears...

line.text: Ah! You... you are the ghost of the future, are you not?
Though I fear you the most of all spirits.. Show me. Show me what it is that I must learn.

mission.name: Lesson Learned
mission.desc: The spirits have finished visiting Samael, leaving him with wisdom that he must decipher. But he understands that he has been given a second chance. He is determined not to waste it.

line.text: Jingle, jingle- Ahh! You!
Pardon me.... I... apologize for earlier. Might I join you in your song and dance?
Oh! Yes, of course! Gladly!

mission.name: Thieving Heroes
mission.desc: You've learned that the more Mist Pearls that the Seafolk raiders possess, the stronger their summoning will be for Lady Scylla. If you could steal some of their reserves, it would weaken the sea monster...

mission.name: Against the Tide
mission.desc: The Mist Pearl is a type of catalyst for the raiders' summoning. Every little bit you can take will weaken the revival of their Lady of the Sea.

mission.name: To Become Stronger
mission.desc: You have heard tales of a remarkable healer who hails from Golden Crown Village. Deciding to investigate, your journey to track the healer eventually leads you to Duskwillow. However, the entire area is being attacked by monsters that rise up from the sea...

mission.name: Seafolk Plunderers
mission.desc: The merfolk ravage the town that lies next to a great bay. Citizens flee in panic. Gathering your team, you lead them against the raiders.

line.text: I am the great Scylla's Servant! Bow down, or FACE MY FIST!

mission.name: Zolmosh the Fist
mission.desc: Your forces face the greatest resistance from a merman named Zolmosh. It seems that he, too, has arrived in Duskwillow for a similar reason to your own...

line.text: Find her! Find the frog who dares defy Lady Scylla, the one with the healing touch; the one who contests The Void's magic!

mission.name: Hasty Retreat
mission.desc: The seafolk are repelled by your band's fierce attacks. More and more fall. The remaining force retreats back to the bay, stragglers struggling to escape.

line.text: Ugh... They are powerful. Men, retreat! Though we lost this battle, the war is far from over!

mission.name: Abandoned Residences
mission.desc: With the seafolk pushed back, you can now resume your search for the legendary frog. Most of the town has been deserted during the attack...

mission.name: The Frog Travelers
mission.desc: After considerable searching, you see a small band of frogs. Recognizing their attire as those from Golden Crown, you approach and ask about their fabled healer.

line.text: Rrribbit! What makes you think we can trust you? You think we'd just tell you where to find the healer?

mission.name: Hostile Allies
mission.desc: The Golden Crown frogs refuse to trust you. Worse than that, they seem to think you're in league with the seafolk! Despite your attempts to talk with them, the frogs raise their weapons and attack!

mission.name: Strength to Prove
mission.desc: The frogs are fierce. However, killing them certainly won't make them trust you. You try your best to defend yourself and prove your strength, while still trying to earn their trust and refrain from hurting them too badly.

line.text: Mayor... forgive us. This one... they are very strong!

mission.name: Peacemaker
mission.desc: All the frogs have fought their hardest, but none can defeat you. They lie panting upon the ground, waiting for you to decide their fate...

line.text: You are too strong... it is over.
What is all this noise out here?

mission.name: Loyal Companions
mission.desc: The frogs do their best to defend the frog woman who appeared from one of the houses. They seem particularly alarmed that she has shown herself to you.

line.text: Mayor, no! Return inside. These people have come after you.

mission.name: The Golden Crown Hero
mission.desc: The Golden Crown Mayor remembers how you saved her son. She knows that you and your group are heroes that have decided to fight against The Void. Telling the other frogs to stand down, the Golden Crown Mayor promises to listen to your purpose.

line.text: Nonsense. These people are great heroes of Golden Crown. Now what can I do to help?

mission.name: Recruiting the Healer
mission.desc: You explain to the Golden Crown Mayor that you have heard about her amazing healing powers. It is said that she can cure even those who have been corrupted by The Void.

line.text: We originally came here to help those afflicted by The Void's power.
My duties will not allow me to join your adventure permanently. But I will do what I can, at least until we remove The Void's power from this area.

mission.name: The Boy and His Dragon
mission.desc: With the Golden Crown Mayor now helping you, you follow the bay's shoreline. In the distance, you spot two figures that have washed up on the beach...

line.text: Ugh... h-hey buddy, you okay?
Awoo...

mission.name: Incoming Storm
mission.desc: You recognize the human figure from your time in Karthos. It seems he's finally managed to tame a dragon. A strange figure rises from the water's waves, stalking towards the two. You hurry to get closer...

mission.name: Seafolk Raider
mission.desc: It's one of the Seafolk raiders! You run with all your might towards the two on the beach. Decim holds the drake tightly, protecting it with his body, flinging firebolts against his foes. The waves begin to swell.

mission.name: The Guardian
mission.desc: Despite your best efforts, it's impossible to reach Decim and his friend before the enemy. As the raider launches an attack, a new armored figure appears to protect the two!

line.text: Wooosh!
STAY BACK OR YOU'RE GONNA GET BURNED!
-raises lantern, deflecting the attack directed at Decim-

mission.name: Tension
mission.desc: You arrive, a little late, but still in time to check Decim and his friend. They look like they've taken quite the beating, but at least they're still alive.

line.text: Whoa, thanks. That was close.
W... What? Why you staring, huh? What - keep that sword down!

mission.name: Former Ally
mission.desc: The lantern guardian attacks! You intervene to protect Decim and the drake. The former ally has changed to foe quite quickly...

mission.name: Dubious Intentions
mission.desc: Decim is in no shape to fight. You must face this mysterious foe in his place, and keep everyone safe from the silent attacker. But what could he want?

line.text: Ohh man. If you weren't here to help me, this guy woulda got me for sure.
Hey guy, what's the deal? You helped me out earlier just to laugh at me now?!

mission.name: The End of an Alliance
mission.desc: You attempt to talk with the savior-turned-destroyer. Yet all he does is utter a single word...

line.text: Behind...
Behind... What?
Grrr....

mission.name: Heartbreak
mission.desc: The drake that was with Decim has become feral. Foam runs from its mouth, claws scratching against Decim and anyone else it can reach.

line.text: Whoa, buddy! What's gotten in to you?
Grrr....

mission.name: Potential Solution
mission.desc: At long last the wind drake has been subdued. It lies panting on the ground, foam still trickling from its mouth. Despite Decim's grievous injuries, he rises to his feet, prepared to help his friend no matter the cost...

line.text: There is only one solution to those infected by The Void.
No! I won't let you!

mission.name: True Peace
mission.desc: You manage to convince Decim to stand down before he hurts himself further. Behind you, the Golden Crown Mayor pushes her way forward. She lays her healing hands upon the wind drake...

line.text: Now now, no need for such violence. Let me heal your dragon friend, and I'll make it right as rain.

mission.name: Recruiting the Guardian
mission.desc: The drake is healed beneath the Mayor's touch. Decim also calms upon seeing his friend's health return. The Lantern Guardian approaches you...

line.text: Truly amazing... never seen arcane arts that heal even Void-infected. Allow me to join your cause, and fight against these raiders.

mission.name: The Tide Swells...
mission.desc: The great sea serpent Scylla has awoken from the water's darkest depths, washing away the earth with her torrential tide. You will need to be very well prepared for this battle.

mission.name: The Waves Crash...
mission.desc: The great sea serpent Scylla has awoken from the water's darkest depths, washing away the earth with her torrential tide. You will need to be very well prepared for this battle.

mission.name: Scylla, Sea's Torment
mission.desc: The great sea serpent Scylla has awoken from the water's darkest depths, washing away the earth with her torrential tide. You will need to be very well prepared for this battle.

mission.name: Rumors of the Powerful
mission.desc: With the Guardian now helping you, you decide to search for more resources to fight against Scylla and her raiders. You have heard tales of a powerful sword-wielder that once lived in Duskwillow. If you could find him, he could help against your upcoming fight with Scylla...

mission.name: Quiet as the Grave
mission.desc: This part of town has already been ravaged by the Seafolk raiders. Everything is eerily quiet, monsters rummaging through abandoned residences...

mission.name: Offended Residents
mission.desc: You enter a house that seems oddly intact compared to its neighbors. As soon as you step inside, a figure appears behind you in the doorframe, and attacks!

line.text: You've walked straight into our trap, pirates. Let's get 'em!

mission.name: Not Your Enemy
mission.desc: Avians, the original inhabitants of Duskwillow, pour into the room. You try to explain to them that you are not with the Seafolk raiders...

line.text: You say you're not a pirate? A likely story. The pirates have scales, and fins, and...
...And you don't have any of those things, do you.
Screeeech!

mission.name: Closer to the Truth
mission.desc: The Avian tries to settle the feral birds, but it seems you've convinced them of your allegiance. You use the opportunity to ask about the swordsman you heard about...

line.text: Aye, there once was a man whose family was destroyed by Scylla. He went off to find a means of defeating her.
He was gone for months... and then he came back with the pirates, attacking our homes!

mission.name: Plan of Action
mission.desc: Thanking the Avians, you depart the house and head towards the shore, where they last saw the swordsman. You wonder why someone who aims to fight Scylla would join her cause...

line.text: He must have been infected by The Void. I can see no reason why he'd willingly help his sworn enemy.
Well, I'll just have to fix him up right and proper. A little healing magic and he'll be as good as new!

mission.name: Familiar Foe
mission.desc: True to the Avians' description, you find the Seafolk raiders and a mysterious cloaked man at the designated location. You recognize the man as the assassin who nearly killed you and Tarian in Karthos!

line.text: You are fools to chase us all the way out here. Men, get them!

mission.name: Corruption of Morals
mission.desc: With the Seafolk invaders out of the way, the Golden Crown Mayor approaches the assassin. Swirling tendrils of energy surround him.

line.text: It's as we suspected. The poor boy was infected by The Void, but should return to his senses thanks to my healing.
... Hahaha...

mission.name: The Assassin
mission.desc: The energy has faded, but the man does not cease his attacks. If anything, he seems to strike against you with even more passion.

line.text: What, were you expecting a 'thank you'? I draw my powers from The Void.
We have no reason to be allies!

mission.name: One True Enemy
mission.desc: You and your friends try to sway the Assassin's opinion. He seems to only be fighting because he enjoys it. If you could have his help against Scylla, he could become a useful ally...

line.text: After all that Scylla has done to you, I expected you to resist her powers. Not welcome it.
Scylla...? No, I accepted The Void's powers to fight against her.

mission.name: Enemy Coverage
mission.desc: The Assassin contemplates your words. His Seafolk allies continue their onslaught, uncaring whether the Assassin aids them or not.

mission.name: The Price of Power
mission.desc: The Assassin's blade wavers. It was never his intention to help Scylla. All he wanted was the power of The Void.

line.text: It is through The Void's blessing that I can strike like a shadow, before my enemies are aware of my presence.
And it is also through The Void's power that you became a thrall to the one who destroyed your kin.

mission.name: Recruiting the Assassin
mission.desc: A temporary alliance has been formed. The Assassin will aid you, for a brief time...

line.text: It seems we have a reason to be allies after all.
I will aid you... but only until Scylla rests at the bottom of the sea.

mission.name: To Tip the Scales
mission.desc: You have decided to go on the offensive against Scylla. Her raiders have retreated into the bay, gathering Mist Pearls. You scour the edge of the village for any usable boats...

mission.name: Close Quarters
mission.desc: You find a small boat that can just barely fit all of your companions. You shove off a few stray monsters and prepare to set sail.

mission.name: Raider Opposition
mission.desc: The Seafolk raiders see you trying to get closer to their base. They raise their defenses, meeting you while you're still out in the bay!

line.text: Stop them! Don't let them get any closer; they'll interrupt the summoning of Lady Scylla!

mission.name: Out in the Open
mission.desc: One of the raiders managed to pierce through your vessel's hull. Water leaks inside, and your boat begins to slowly sink. You continue to sail towards the Raiders' base, hoping to make it before the boat sinks...

mission.name: The Ranger
mission.desc: Your ankles are covered in water by the time you reach the island. When you step onto land, a familiar face is there waiting for you...

line.text: Ahoy there, adventurer! Long time no see. The Elarian researchers sent me here t' collect some samples of Mist Pearls. But ya can see the mess this place is in now.
Whaddya say we team up, jus' like old times, eh?

mission.name: Avian Traitors
mission.desc: More than just the Seafolk forces are here. Some of the resident Avians have joined the raiders to revive Scylla!

line.text: Do you honestly believe you can stop Lady Scylla? None can compare to her might.

mission.name: Dusted Willow
mission.desc: With the first wave of Avians and Seafolk banished, your party decides to take a quick break. The Ranger tells you about the history of Duskwillow...

line.text: D'ya know about why they called this place Duskwillow? There used t' be a great willow, right in th' middle a town.
But when th' raiders attacked, they burned it right down. Nothin' but a pile o' ashes now... real shame.

mission.name: Duskwillow's Sorrow
mission.desc: The Ranger laments the sorry state of Duskwillow. He has traveled to many places and seen many sights, but the power of The Void causes unspeakable tragedies.

line.text: Aye... Duskwillow was a home t' frogs an' avians both. But now look, Scylla has convinced 'em to fight even their own family...
We must stop this madness.

mission.name: Pushing Onward
mission.desc: You break camp, taking your party deeper towards the heart of the raiders' base. Stopping their summoning would be much easier than fighting against the Lady of the Sea herself.

mission.name: Daunting Wall
mission.desc: You reach a long fortress wall with spiked pikes. A glow emanates from within, stretching up into the heavens. This must be where they are performing the summoning...

line.text: It might seem like an impressive wall, but the tiniest o' cracks can make the whole thing crumble.
HIIIII-YA!

mission.name: Almost There
mission.desc: The entire wall crumbles beneath the Ranger's attack! A host of enemies pours through the broken walls, intent on stopping your advance.

line.text: It's all about knowin' where to hit 'em at their weakest point. An-
They're this far already?! Keep them occupied just a little longer!

mission.name: Recruiting the Ranger
mission.desc: The entire earth rumbles. A terrible sea serpent rises where the light once was, letting out a ferocious cry...

line.text: Is that... Scylla? Guess you'll need me for one last fight, eh.
Clear out the remaining foes, and then focus on her.
Less talk, more killing.
My, aren't you a fiesty one!

mission.name: Frigore's Bounty
mission.desc: Frigore boasts the highest quantity of a mystical resource known as Snowdust. Each particle contains a small amount of magical energy, which powerful artifacts can absorb to become even stronger.

mission.name: Snowdust Rivals
mission.desc: Beasts and strange adventurers roam Frigore. Have they also come to collect the Snowdust, or are they after you? You must fight them off if you want the resources to become stronger.

mission.name: Rumors of Frigore
mission.desc: You have heard stories of powerful artifacts that can directly combat the powers of The Void. It's for this reason that you've traveled to the frozen wastelands of Arcantica, known as Frigore.

mission.name: Two Old Men
mission.desc: While searching for the artifacts, you spot two forms, face-down in the snow. You are surprised to find that anyone is in an area that's supposed to be abandoned. You run up to them to see if the two are okay...

line.text: Malchior, is that frail body of yours harmed?
A little singe on my whiskers, but otherwise quite alright.

mission.name: A Tale of Adventure
mission.desc: Roaming monsters attempt to take advantage of the injured duo's state. You fight them off, giving Malchior and Tarian time to collect themselves...

line.text: You have our thanks, adventurer. We were investigating a report of a Void contraption, only for Samael to interfere.
The fool collapsed the Trivolutum ley line, resulting in an explosion that is likely to attract more of The Void. Harumph!

mission.name: Samael's Influence
mission.desc: Before the three of you can continue, you notice some figures off in the near distance. A small group has formed on a snowy hilltop, looking straight at you...

line.text: I say, are those friends of yours, adventurer? Over here, friends!
No, look closer. Angels... Samael's forces have followed us!

mission.name: Mercenary Angels
mission.desc: You fight off a swarm of angels and mercenaries. Drawn in by Malchior's and Tarian's presence, they cut down anyone who stands in their way.

mission.name: Missing Friend
mission.desc: At last you manage to defeat the scouts that were sent to pursue your friends. But Malchior and Tarian have other concerns...

line.text: General Garrick stayed behind to fight the creature that emerged from The Void's Spellstone.
Adventurer.... could we trouble you to help our ally? If he's still alive, he may still be of use to us.

mission.name: Duskwillow Shield
mission.desc: Malchior takes out a small shield with a peculiar design. It almost looks like a tree stump grows out of it. He promises you the artifact in exchange for finding Garrick.

line.text: Of course, we wouldn't trouble you lightly. Do you see this shield?
It's a legendary artifact from Duskwillow, where fanatics of a terrible beast called Scylla-
Oh, familiar with Duskwillow already, are you?! Fascinating, I love meeting fellow scholars! If you'd be willing to help us, then this shield is yours.

mission.name: Artifact of Power
mission.desc: You remember how powerful the Aegis of the Sea was in your adventures in Duskwillow. Having an artifact of similar properties could prove beneficial, even if it needs a little Snowdust to get recharged.

mission.name: Discus Throw
mission.desc: Malchior has agreed to give you the shield. He balances it in his hands, before tossing it like a discus, far away from you! It spins and flies away...

line.text: Excellent. Now catch!
Why did you throw it so far away...

mission.name: Reclaiming the Shield
mission.desc: Malchior seems excited to be traveling with you again. Tarian is far more concerned with his ally, and the enemies that pursue you and the group.

line.text: All the more reason to hurry! Can't let one of those angels pick up the shield instead, eh?

mission.name: Would-Be Thieves
mission.desc: As you finally catch up to the place where the shield landed, you notice another group of angels. One has stopped over the shield, and seems to be examining it...

mission.name: Staunch Enemies
mission.desc: The angel picks up the shield... You will have to fight her to claim it! With more of Samael's forces lurking about, it would be best to take care of it quickly.

line.text: What's this... I feel some kind of power in the shield? Lord Samael would be most interested in an artifact of this caliber. Stand aside!

mission.name: Tough Terrain
mission.desc: With the legendary shield in hand, you properly start your quest to find General Garrick. The frozen wastelands of Frigore has tough terrain, which breeds tough monsters.

mission.name: Enemies Ahead
mission.desc: Angels also continue to harry your path. Your search is delayed by their attacks, but you have no choice but to push through.

line.text: Even should I fall, my duty is done. Lord Samael will deal with you soon.

mission.name: Wings of Trouble
mission.desc: The angels have just been stalling you. As another one of their scout falls, you see a familiar pair of wings approaching you and your group...

line.text: I knew I'd find you Chaos fools still attempting to complete your old plan. Now-
You... I know you. You're the adventurer who faced me at The Void!

mission.name: Bitter Memories
mission.desc: A frightening look of fury crosses over the normally stoic leader's face. A long time has passed since you first defeated him at The Void. He orders all of his angels to attack.

line.text: Adventurer. I have scoured the entire world for you, and yet you eluded my grasp.
That doesn't sound like something a healthy person would do.
I did not need your aid! I would have escaped The Void's influence by myself!

mission.name: Vindictive Justice
mission.desc: Samael is fixated on vengeance. By defeating him at the peak of his plans, you have harmed his pride. He has forgotten his original plans in a desire to find revenge.

line.text: Do you see this sword? It burns through the magic fibers that The Void relies upon for controlling one's mind.
Surrender, or I'll use it against you next!

mission.name: In His Name
mission.desc: You fight wave after wave of angels. Samael has always had a difficult time admitting defeat, and he is blind to the allies that fall in his name.

mission.name: Blazing Faith
mission.desc: At long last, Samael's barrage of attacks begins to falter. Even if he wants to continue fighting, the angels around him have grown weary. It is only a matter of time...

line.text: No... I cannot lose again. Dyrnwyn, my sword... Give me strength!

mission.name: Lost Faith
mission.desc: The angels have given up, even though Samael still tries to fight. The sword slips from his hand, piercing into the frozen ground. Samael grabs the handle, trying desperately to draw it out of the earth. But the blade refuses...

line.text: Dyrnwyn, no... Even you refuse to continue this crusade?!
Adventurer... we shall meet again. I promise you this!

mission.name: Blade of Ashes
mission.desc: Samael and his host of angels leave the sword, unable to reclaim it. They retreat, leaving you finally alone with your allies. Cautiously you approach the sword, which has lost its flame while being embedded in the earth...

mission.name: Sentient Sword
mission.desc: When you grab onto the sword, its flame comes to life. And you hear a whisper in your head, its words too quiet for you to make out. You think it might be speaking in some other language. You tell your companions about the sentient sword...

line.text: Dyrnwyn, hmm... I have heard legends of it. They say it is a spirit of an angel that takes physical form as a sword.

mission.name: Another Future
mission.desc: The sword imprints images into your mind. You see a new land you have never visited before, and Oda and Elyse, holding a staff. The Void's power erupts like a volcano. Something steps out of the abyss... The images fade from your mind, like sand slipping through your fingers.

mission.name: With Sword in Hand
mission.desc: You tell your companions the vision that the sword imparted to you. They find it interesting, but aren't sure what to make of it. You notice some houses on the horizon, and a cavern near its bridge.

line.text: An intelligent sword, fascinating! I wonder what it was trying to tell you?
A strange story, but let's press on for General Garrick. Look, there's a village ahead, and a cave near that bridge.
Let's split up. Malchior and I will check in town for General Garrick, and you can check the cave, adventurer.

mission.name: Wisdom
mission.desc: The sword has only shown you a fraction of its power. The spirit inside does not trust you enough with its true abilities. You beseech the blade for a chance to prove your worth...

mission.name: Justice
mission.desc: The spirit takes a familiar form of its former wielder. Hosts of angels appear in the same fashion, illusions fashioned to test your limits. You feel its presence press against your mind, feeling its wordless questions: Are you patient? Are you strong? Are you worthy?

mission.name: Temperance
mission.desc: You feel like every action you take - or don't take - is being watched and weighed carefully. The sword gives you a glimpse of the last one who took this test, of Samael and his hasty zeal... And his ultimate failure.

mission.name: Courage
mission.desc: The sword's spirit seems to trust you; you have made progress. Its only question left is whether you have the will to face The Void, even in the hardest situations. Prove to Dyrnwyn that you are capable.

mission.name: Alone Again
mission.desc: Malchior and Tarian have parted ways from you. You travel towards the cave, which could have been a potential resting place to avoid the last snowfall. Undead roam this area, making progress difficult.

mission.name: Injured General
mission.desc: You haven't journeyed far when you see a human figure, slouched over. A small pool of blood has formed near him in the snow. You rush over to help him.

line.text: Uggh.... Is someone... there?

mission.name: Spiritual Aid
mission.desc: The man is losing consciousness. You cry out for help, but you are alone... until Drynwyn blazes with light. You see a vision - just a flicker, but a brief glimpse of a path inside the cave, leading to a magical spring. In the vision, when the waters touch the injured man, he's healed.

mission.name: Spring's Guardians
mission.desc: Taking Dyrnwyn's vision as a sign of its help, you shoulder the man and head inside. You see the spring, its water glowing an odd blue. Undead rise from the ground, protecting the mysterious water.

mission.name: Have We Met?
mission.desc: At last, you manage to drive back the undead, giving you full access to the cave's spring. You lift the water to Garrick's lips, letting him drink. His wounds begin to close, just like the vision you saw.

line.text: Thank you, adventurer. My name is Garrick.
Wait, you're-

mission.name: Secrets to Hide
mission.desc: General Garrick becomes extremely agitated. He squirms in your grasp, starting to visibly sweat. You try to calm him down, before he re-opens his freshly healed wounds.

line.text: S-sorry to bother you, adventurer. I should- I should really get going now-
What's the hurry, -General-?

mission.name: Persona
mission.desc: A familiar figure emerges from the spring! He walks out of it, yet the waters do not part, as if he has no physical form. Garrick's eyes widen in fear as the specter takes shape.

line.text: Who ARE you?
I'm you. The REAL you. Anyone who drinks from this spring must face their true self.

mission.name: Darkness Within
mission.desc: Undead rise again from the ground, while ghosts emerge from the spring's waters. Shadow Garrick commands them to attack, forcing you to defend both yourself and the real Garrick.

line.text: All this talk about fighting The Void, while we ignore the problem of the Aether right in front of us?
They've been looking for a fight for far too long... let us take the battle to them!
No... You can't be me.

mission.name: Spring's Reinforcements
mission.desc: The spring's reinforcements seem infinite. Each time you cut down one of the stray spirits, another takes its place. You change your direction, aiming for the shadow that seems to be controlling them, but first you must clear a path...

mission.name: Facing One's Self
mission.desc: The shadow spirit shrinks away as you and Garrick get closer. More enemies have already replaced the ones you defeated, and you are completely surrounded. But the leader stands right in front of you, and you seize the chance to end this once and for all...

line.text: Working with The Void was a blessing! No need to dance around politics, free from the allegiance of any of the factions!
Maybe... a small part of me felt that way. But I have a responsibility to those around me. I can't run away from that... or from you.

mission.name: Accepting One's Self
mission.desc: The spring's spirit roars as you finally defeat it. Its form fades away, as the other undead begin to disappear with it. You are finally left with a quiet moment, alone with General Garrick.

line.text: So... There's no point in hiding it now, then. You and I... we've fought in the past.
I was under the influence of The Void, but it's still no excuse. I don't blame you if you decide you want revenge...

mission.name: Debt to Be Paid
mission.desc: You tell Garrick that Tarian and Malchior have been looking for him. The two of you leave the spring, heading towards the village you saw previously.

line.text: If I ever get the chance to repay you for what you did for me, I will.

mission.name: To Be Reunited
mission.desc: When you arrive at the village, you find it not as peaceful as it seemed. No living soul roams the area... but plenty of undead do. The entire place is a literal ghost town, the spirits' attention snapping towards you.

line.text: This town has clearly been abandoned for some time. But Malchior and Lord Tarian... where are they? They may need our help; let us move on!

mission.name: Ghost Town
mission.desc: You begin your search, but your progress is made slow by the roaming undead. They flock to you like moths to the flame, clawing over their own just to reach you.

mission.name: Frigore's Power
mission.desc: Past the initial wave, you are able to cover more ground. If Tarian and Malchior are here, then they might be in trouble with such creatures on the prowl.

line.text: Adventurer, do you know that certain places in Arcantica are tied more strongly to The Void?
It's more than simple attraction. The Void is actually leaking into our world. Frigore is one such place... perhaps the Snowdust is to blame.

mission.name: Signs of Allies
mission.desc: The sun is starting to set, a cold wind falling upon the abandoned village. You notice tendrils of smoke rising in the distance, behind a few houses. Perhaps your friends are located there...

mission.name: The Living and Undead
mission.desc: When you reach the smoke's source, you find a burning blue fire. Malchior and Tarian have set up camp, some distance away from the undead, although you're uncertain just how safe this location is.

line.text: Why hello there, good timing!
Garrick... I see you yet count yourself among the living.

mission.name: Mission Unlikely
mission.desc: You keep guard over the camp while your friends rejoice over Garrick's return. But soon enough their conversation turns to a more serious note, one that you can't help but overhear.

line.text: We were interrupted earlier, but I believe now is a good time. What's the status of the mission you were on?
There are key points in the world where the fabric of reality seems weaker. The Void attaches itself to these spots, entering our world through these weak points.

mission.name: A Sage's Musings
mission.desc: Malchior's combines the knowledge he already possesses with Garrick's information. The Void has long been plaguing Arcantica, with most steps only treating the symptoms, rather than finding a cure.

line.text: Hmm. Every door has both an entrance and exit. If The Void is entering through these locations, then...
...It means that we can use the same places to enter The Void's realm.

mission.name: Mounting an Offense
mission.desc: The party contemplates on how to reach the realm of The Void. It would be the first time that they could mount a proper offense against the enemy that has been invading Arcantica.

line.text: Is that even possible?
Yes, but only with the correct setup...

mission.name: Rumors of The Void Dimension
mission.desc: In order to reach this gateway to The Void, you will need some help in the metaphysical realm. Lucky for you, a certain spirit might be interested in helping... if you've proven yourself worthy.

line.text: Adventurer, how close are you to that magical sword? If we use the Heart of Blue Fire as a catalyst, and channel our energy...
Then an interdimensional being could hold the momentary gate open long enough for someone in this realm to pass into the other plane of existence.

mission.name: Some Assembly Required
mission.desc: In the dying sun's light, your companions lay out all the magical items you have collected - the Duskwillow Shield, Dyrnwyn, and a small vial of Life Water. Malchior begins to assemble them all together, until you have a sword unlike that which Arcantica has ever seen.

mission.name: Open Sesame
mission.desc: Malchior takes inventory of all the relics you have collected in your journey. By combining what you have, more paths will be open to you.

line.text: Now adventurer, hold onto the Heart of Blue Fire in one hand, and the artifacts in your other.
We'll use the remaining Snowdust's power to open a gate to The Void Plane!

mission.name: In the Name of Friendship
mission.desc: Malchior arranges the snowdust in a peculiar fashion. He instructs Garrick and Tarian on how they can help send you to The Void Plane.

line.text: Now Tarian, Garrick. Stand around and give me your hands.
To channel the energy?
It makes a good friendship pose!

mission.name: A New Adventure
mission.desc: The snowdust energy collects around the fringe of the camp, sparkling like glistening raindrops beneath the fire's light. They form a blue portal of swirling energy. For a moment you think you see a white robe holding the gate open, and then it is gone, leaving just the portal.

line.text: The Void Plane is something of a legend. The world will mirror our own, but be something else entirely.
Are you ready, adventurer? The gate has opened! Now go!

mission.name: The Mad Bomber
mission.desc: A man has appeared juggling bombs. No one knows where he came from, but those bombs don't look happy. See if you can rescue them!

mission.name: The Sad Bomber
mission.desc: Man those bombs look depressed. We should pick up something for them at the store on our way over.

mission.name: The Glad Bomber
mission.desc: Did you see that? I think he smiled. He must have been lonely. I'm sure he has some tragic backstory and he really just wanted the power of friendship to save him. Or he just likes exploding things.

mission.name: The Rad Bomber
mission.desc: Man, I wish I was cool enough to hang out near an exploding volcano. Mad jealous.

mission.name: Chicken Assault
mission.desc: Reports of a figure assaulting civilians with chickens are pouring in. Someone should probably do something. Probably you.

mission.name: Chickens, Chickens Everywhere
mission.desc: OH MY GODS THEY ARE EVERYWHERE. WHY DO I GO ANYWHERE WITH YOU. NOTHING GOOD HAPPENS.

mission.name: Chicken Appreciation Day
mission.desc: Seriously, everytime we go on an adventure something goes wrong. Why do I hang out with you?

mission.name: Chicken Divebombs
mission.desc: Are those chickens FALLING FROM THE SKY?! Chickens can't even FLY! Someone needs to teach this artist about chicken physics.

mission.name: Doomsday
mission.desc: There's something in the lake. Probably not a good something. You should probably do something about it. Maybe. Do what you want I'm not a cop.

mission.name: Doomsday 2, Electric Boogaloo
mission.desc: Oh hey, you did it. Wait, no it's still here. Try again.

mission.name: The Day That Doomed
mission.desc: That thing really is made of something else. Keep trying? I'm not sure, I'll consult the manual while you do.

mission.name: Doomest Day
mission.desc: Ah. Killing it only makes it stronger. Until it doesn't get stronger. And then it dies. Right here in the manual. I guess keep hitting it until it doesn't get up. Don't look at me, I don't make the rules.

mission.name: TyrantShiva
mission.desc: Deep in the customer support dungeons of the Evil Castle lives TyrantShiva, the most caring bear in all the realm!

mission.name: MerMod
mission.desc: Protecting the inner sactums of the Evil Castle, MerMod is the first line of defense for those that wish to enter. Beware! Her hammer may be fatal if you don't follow the rules!

mission.name: Obyto14
mission.desc: In the tallest tower of the Evil Castle lives the laziest of all the developers. Obyto14 resides here, nerfing your favorite cards and definitely not answering QA Threads on time!

mission.name: Purple Souls
mission.desc: When you defeat the creatures in this realm, some of them leave behind fragments of their souls. The energy reminds you of the power from the Blue Fire Souls.

mission.name: Energy Consumption
mission.desc: Your relics shine faintly with light whenever exposed to the Purple Fire Souls. Defeating the dragons and undead in the area, you collect more energy to feed to your relics.

mission.name: New World Order
mission.desc: You arrive in a strange land that ignores the laws of physics. A great ship is torn in half, sprawled across the sky. Behind you is a dark sun that radiates cold energy. The wind smells of sulfur. As you climb floating stairs, you see at least one thing that seems familiar...

line.text: Keep your eyes peeled. We don't know what to expect here.
Is that - the adventurer who helped us in Elaria? Over here! It's good to see another familiar face.

mission.name: Old Alliance
