mission.desc: You've managed to find two old allies in this strange realm. It is one comfort in a place where exotic, hostile creatures roam the floating islands.

line.text: Groc used the Seastone Staff we brought back to send us into The Void Plane.
But how did you get here, adventurer?

mission.name: Dyrnwyn's Transformation
mission.desc: When you start to explain your journey in Frigore, you take out the sword Dyrnwyn to show them its power. Yet the sword has changed since entering this realm - it has absorbed the Duskwillow Shield and Life Water, forming a new weapon of even greater power.

mission.name: Seastone Staff
mission.desc: The Seastone Staff is an artifact part of Oda's Order. It has been passed down by generations of monks to those who have proven their worth. You can feel a special power from within it, something similar to your sword Dyrnwyn.

line.text: Then we're here for the same cause: to find a way to end The Void's power.
If we can find where The Void is leaking into our world, then we could stop The Void's invasion... permanently.
I think you should hold onto the Seastone Staff. We'll combine our resources together.

mission.name: Hungry Voidlings
mission.desc: Strange creatures, some mix of undead and others more dragon-like, are drawn to you as if by some unseen force. Sensing that you are not part of The Void, they gather and attack...

mission.name: New Foes
mission.desc: In this upside-down world, you cannot always tell whether you're moving forward or backwards. You pass by landmarks that seem suspiciously familiar. One particular skeleton raises its sword and points towards you, giving an oddly human-like shriek...

line.text: Aieeeee!

mission.name: Inverse Reality
mission.desc: The monsters seem to pause as Elyse speaks. Their attacks falter, the skeleton in particular looking at the group in confusion.

line.text: 'Aieee'? That's an odd sound from a skeleton.
What's that? You flesh creatures can TALK!?

mission.name: The Polite Skeleton
mission.desc: The skeleton stops swinging wildly at the group. A few seconds pass as he stares at you. Finally, he lowers his cane. It seems he's willing to talk to you.

line.text: I am extremely sorry for the mishap. We have never seen such well-articulated flesh creatures. Why, normally they roar and bare their teeth! Terrifying.
Wait, aren't you a skeleton, though? Why is it that you can - err. Never mind. It's nice to meet you, um, Mister Skeleton.
Please, call me Aldus.

mission.name: Truth of the Heart
mission.desc: Aldus the skeleton tells you about his quest in The Void Plane. He is after a powerful artifact that his master has lost, and his description of it is suspiciously like an item you already possess...

line.text: I'm on a quest for Master Bluefire, you see. I'm looking for his lost heart.
Master... Bluefire? The Heart of Blue Fire?
Yes! Have you heard of it? He's been quite distraught since its disappearance.

mission.name: New Powers
mission.desc: You take out your Heart of Blue Fire. Yet parts of it are different than what you remember. Perhaps entering The Void Plane has altered its form.

mission.name: Whispers of the End
mission.desc: The skeleton gasps as you show show him the Heart of Blue Fire. He clearly recognizes it as the object he's been searching for. However, you are hesitant to hand over such a powerful artifact of The Void.

line.text: That's it! You have the heart of Master Bluefire! Oh, he will be so pleased.
Who is this... 'Master Bluefire'?
He's the ruler of The Void, naturally.

mission.name: Lost Heart
mission.desc: A horrible screech rends the air, causing both your group and the monsters to shudder. Above you, you see a pair of wings enveloped in a blue flame, descending towards your allies...

line.text: Master Bluefire, down here! We've found your lost heart!

mission.name: Soulless Aggression
mission.desc: A blue flame sparks nearby. Fire begins to eat the landscape around you, yet the blue fire is devoid of warmth. Creatures of scales and rotting flesh rise from the ground, soulless eyes fixated on you.

mission.name: Wings of Bluefire
mission.desc: The wings in the sky descend towards your group. It has scales and wings like a dragon, yet there is a spark of intelligence in its eye, much different than the beasts of Arcantica. When it opens its maw, the beast speaks...

line.text: Thou hast thoughtlessly wandered into my kingdom, believing thyself invincible.
Yet previous victories do not predict success of the present.

mission.name: Minions
mission.desc: The creatures press closer at the dragon's words. They are eager to make enemies against those who oppose their Master. Each defeated soul simply spawns a new one in its place.

line.text: Oh! Do you know these people, Master Bluefire?

mission.name: Apologetic Skeleton
mission.desc: Even one you thought might be a possible ally has turned quickly on you, albeit apologetically. You have been deemed a threat by The Void...

line.text: Destroy them, for they are enemies who seeketh The Void's destruction.
Oh, I'm terribly sorry, fellows. It appears we have no choice but to kill you. Please don't take it personally.

mission.name: Fighting Further
mission.desc: Waves of the monsters throw themselves upon you. You and your companions have come prepared for a fight. Oda and Elyse pool their strength with yours, creating a formidable position that the monsters are unable to breach.

mission.name: Blue Gaze
mission.desc: When you focus on the monsters before you, you're able to cut them down without much trouble. But whenever your gaze meets Bluefire's, the Plane's reality distorts, and the creatures fight back even stronger...

line.text: Dost thou not remember our first meeting? Think back... and remember...

mission.name: Violent Memories
mission.desc: You feel a harsh presence that presses against your mind, clawing through your thoughts. It grabs hold of a memory of you have, fighting Samael's Void Abomination. You remember so vividly it's almost as if you're fighting it again...

line.text: I... Have... Been... RELEASED!!!

mission.name: Violent Present
mission.desc: The presence's grip against your mind weakens. You blink and return to the present. The Void's power gushes through the land like a volcano, a familiar figure emerging.

line.text: I AM THE SHADOW OF BLUEFIRE!

mission.name: Mind Over Matter
mission.desc: Even though you were fighting off Bluefire's forces, you feel the presence against your mind again. Pain ripples through your mind whenever you're about to strike or be hit, and your companions flinch in unison. Whatever is happening to you, is also affecting them.

line.text: Ah... My head, it hurts...!
There is an evil presence that is attacking our minds. Try to maintain your inner peace.

mission.name: Opportunists
mission.desc: You feel your strength faltering due to the presence assaulting your mind. The dragons and undead sense a new weakness, renewing their efforts against you.

mission.name: Last Hope
mission.desc: Your companions fall, leaving you the only one left to fight. Yet the enemies show no sign of slowing their assault.

line.text: I'm sorry... I don't know how much more of this I can take.
Just buy us a little time, and we'll rejoin the fight...

mission.name: Broken
mission.desc: Bluefire steps in. As you prepare to fight, you barely get a few swings in before the silence rings hollow in your mind. Pain flares in your head, replaced by nothingness and a dark abyss. Your companions and The Void Plane vanish from your sight.

line.text: Enough. Let thy mind accept the silence it craves.

mission.name: The Balance of Arcantica
mission.desc: Chaos, Aether, Wyld. The factions claim dominion over that which liveth in Arcantica. Thou thinkest The Void be evil, yet that is the furthest from the truth. The Void is the absence of that which ties the factions. And through nothing we have unlimited potential.

mission.name: The Meaning of Peace
mission.desc: Doest thou truly believe that thy world's problems shall be solved with The Void's disappearance? Yet without The Void, the tribes would have no enemy to stand against, and turn against one another. Peace is naught but an excuse for the tribes to take what they want.

mission.name: The Journey of One's Soul
mission.desc: Peace was never within thy heart to begin with. Thou hast conquered many foes, forever in a search to go farther. To get riches. To become powerful. The world is naught but a challenge for you to enjoy. So long as thou continues to pillage for glory, Arcantica shall never know harmony.

mission.name: To Rival Fate
mission.desc: My brethren are called to a higher purpose. Only through The Void shall the tribes be cleansed of the factions. Their love, their hatred, their will, flows into the same stream. Bonded, in harmonious fusion, the world and their soul become one.

line.text: THOU OUGHT HAVE STAYED IN THE ABYSS, WHERE THY SPIRIT WAS ONE WITH ETERNITY.

mission.name: The Calm After a Storm
mission.desc: The pain from your mind has subsided. The panic from the battle has left you. Blackness stretches like a blanket across your mind, and you have an odd sense that this place feels like home.

mission.name: One Remaining Ally
mission.desc: You think that this would be a good place to nap, your consciousness drifting like a cloud through a dream. But some voice keeps calling out to you, calling your name... And then...

line.text: Wake up... Wake up!
You cannot stay here forever. You know this, don't you?

mission.name: Fake Dreams
mission.desc: The facsimile dream ends. You remember your last battle, and your purpose for entering The Void. Yet even with your memories, the darkness refuses to abate. Shadows twist into forms, hands reaching to pull you down into the abyss.

mission.name: A Promise to Endure
mission.desc: The mysterious spirit aids you in your fight against these creatures. Together your power banishes the creatures. Yet the two of you are alone, without sight or sound of Oda and Elyse.

line.text: You made a promise to stand against The Void. Now go and gather your friends. They have need of you.

mission.name: The Shadow Monk
mission.desc: The spirit vanishes, leaving you. Yet you still sense its presence nearby, like a thought that could take form if you called upon it. You call out for your friends... And you hear an answer.

line.text: Oh, it's the adventurer...

mission.name: Goal Achieved?
mission.desc: Oda's image appears before you. Yet something seems different about him, as if he is a different person than the one that you know to be your friend. He lifts his hand to strike you down...

line.text: We've been fighting for so long. Don't you think this silence is more peaceful than anything we could achieve in our world?

mission.name: Reformed Resolve
mission.desc: With some time and reasoning, you are eventually able to convince Oda to cease his assault. He seems saddened that he even tried to harm you.

line.text: I don't know what came over me. You're right... I can't give up now.
A peace that makes us forget our identity is no peace at all. It is just the work of a puppet master.

mission.name: The Shadow Truestriker
mission.desc: Now with Oda following closely, you begin your search for your other lost companion. Wading through the darkness, you look for some sign of her. You call out for Elyse...

mission.name: Unlimited Knowledge?
mission.desc: When you talk to Elyse about returning home, she is resistant. A similar aura covers her, like the cloud that had surrounded Oda. Elyse turns on you, and attacks...

line.text: All the knowledge I've ever wanted is right here. There's nothing worth exploring in the outside world.

mission.name: Reformed Determination
mission.desc: Recognition lights up in Elyse's eyes. She remembers you, and who she is. Just like Oda, you have broken the curse of The Void placed upon her.

line.text: I'm sorry. Knowledge about something is no substitute to experiencing the world first-hand.
The people we've met, the memories we've made... this is what it means to be alive.

mission.name: Abyss Creatures
mission.desc: Both your companions have returned to their senses. Yet as Elyse comes to your side, more of the strange abyss creatures appear from the shadows, rising up to fight you.

mission.name: Lost in Darkness
mission.desc: The darkness shows no sign of disappearing. The path to continue forward is unclear. There must be another way...

line.text: What do we do now?
We can't keep fighting these creatures forever. Let's look for a way out.

mission.name: The Path to Light
mission.desc: As you and your companions begin to search for some means of escape, the same spirit that aided you before materializes. The spirit beckons for you to follow...

line.text: You've done everything in your power to make it this far.
This is the spirit world. And thus, it takes a spirit's power to grant you an exit.

mission.name: Return to the Battlefield
mission.desc: The shadows around you contort, spinning into a portal, light leaking from its inside. The spirit who helped you earlier now ushers you forward, towards the path of faint light.

line.text: It's time for you to return. Finish your fight against Bluefire!

mission.name: Resume the Final Battle
mission.desc: You step inside the portal with Elyse and Oda. The darkness around you is blown away, as if driven off by a powerful force. You find yourself right where you left Bluefire and his minions.

mission.name: Rude Arrival
mission.desc: It seems that while it felt like you were in the darkness for a long time, barely any time has passed at all. Bluefire and his creatures eye you again, preparing to begin the fight anew.

line.text: What's this? You've rejected Master Bluefire's gift of The Void? How peculiar!

mission.name: Lord Bluefire
mission.desc: The waves of creatures part as their Master Bluefire steps forward. The draconic being has his eyes set on you, and for the first time, steps directly against you...

line.text: Thou art the first to return from the abyss of thy own volition.
If I cannot strike thy mind, then I will strike down thy body.

mission.name: A Friend's Protection
mission.desc: As Bluefire begins his assault, Oda steps forward. A barrier forms between Bluefire and the group, diminishing the heat from Bluefire's dragon breath.

line.text: You have no right to act like you're doing us a favor. Enslaving people's minds, stripping what it means to belong to our homes...
I don't consider myself a hero. But I'll do everything I can to stop you.

mission.name: A Friend's Support
mission.desc: Bluefire smashes his entire body into the barrier. The shield crumbles and Bluefire moves to close the distance. He unleashes another draconic breath, singeing your skin, when Elyse places herself between you and The Void Master.

line.text: Our world's not perfect, but that's part of what makes it beautiful.
You want to destroy that. And I can't let that happen.

mission.name: A Friend's Guidance
mission.desc: Your companions fight with a renewed vigor. Since returning from the abyss, you feel a new power coursing through you. It's as if a spirit is guiding your hands, focusing your energy on where to strike.

mission.name: Teamwork
mission.desc: Bluefire roars as he and his creatures struggle to break through your defenses. With Oda and Elyse, and the spirit guiding your back, you make a powerful team. The enemy tides are beginning to thin.

mission.name: What Pride Forged
mission.desc: Creatures that you fought from the abyss begin to rise from The Void's depths. They join the dragon-creatures, combining their efforts to bring the three of you down.

line.text: There shall be no escape... and no mercy!

mission.name: Soul Eater
mission.desc: Hues of blue and purple begin to congregate closer to Bluefire. More and more energy floats to him, the small floating island shimmering with unnatural light.

line.text: Look at those lights! Are those the Blue Fire and Purple Fire souls?
He's up to something...

mission.name: Power Up
mission.desc: The souls enter the hole that once housed Bluefire's heart. Your Heart of Blue Fire trembles, and you can feel it gravitating towards Bluefire. You hold onto it tightly, trying to stop its escape. The Seastone staff begins to glow with an unusual light...

line.text: Look at how the Seastone Staff is shining... It's reacting to this immense power! Let's use it to seal away The Void Master.
ROOOOAR!

mission.name: Key to the Heart
mission.desc: The Heart of Blue Fire just barely slips out of your grasp. You reach to catch it, but it brushes past your fingers before drifting towards Bluefire. You can still feel some of the Heart of Blue Fire essence in your body, but it will only last for a short time.

line.text: Elyse, Adventurer. The stronger Bluefire grows, the stronger the staff reacts. Trick him into using his full power, and then I'll use the staff to seal him away.
Are you ready? This is it, our final battle against The Void!
THOU HAST SEEN BUT A FRACTION OF MY POWER... WITH THE REUNION OF MY HEART, I AM NIGH INVINCIBLE.

mission.name: The World Falters...
mission.desc: With The Void vanquished, you search for the source of the Elementals' restlessness, and investigate a reported gathering of the Servants of Atlas, Solaron, and Vulcanos. You find them, standing over the fallen forms of their Masters, crying out feverishly...

mission.name: Reality Breaks...
mission.desc: The air shimmers and distorts. Amidst the center of the servants' grief, you see a familiar dragon ripping apart the threads of reality. Bluefire's form catches; something is wrong. Caught between the planes of reality, he shrieks in rage...

mission.name: The Storm Assembles...
mission.desc: Only Bluefire's head and chest have made it through the distortion, when his gaze settles to the fallen Titans. Their forms drift towards The Void Master, before fusing and giving him strength. With the hands of Solaron, the arms of Atlas, and the torso of Vulcanos, Bluefire turns to you...

mission.name: The Elements Revolt...
mission.desc: And the servants of the Titans fall upon their knees, crying out loudly, 'Our Master is the One who vanquished our Master, unto life and death do we serve, our Lord Bluefire.' With the weight of the fallen Titans, with all their servants at his disposal, Bluefire roars and fights you once more.

mission.name: Investigating the Elements
mission.desc: You and Rayne have been investigating strange happenings in Beetleton Bunker. What was supposed to be a celebration has instead become an adventure.

mission.name: Feral Insects
mission.desc: Feral Insects roam the honeycomb land. They attack any and all who stand in their way, whether it be Insects from Beetleton or stray adventurers. You fend them off, searching for more Honeycombs.

mission.name: Loose Ends
mission.desc: Previously corrupted river water has been cleansed. Plants inflicted with sickness have been healed. Your next step in your journey takes you underground to the home of the insects, Beetleton Bunker.

line.text: Hmm... Yes, there is nothing visibly corrupt here, either. It's a shame we aren't closer to knowing an answer.

mission.name: Restless Elementals
mission.desc: You and Rayne carefully go through a maze of honeycomb walls, looking for signs of corruption. Blobs of earth from the ground rise at your presence, menacing you both.

mission.name: Frenzied Elementals
mission.desc: The two of you fight off the creatures, which seem to dissipate in a cloud of dust with each strike. Even their numbers cannot hide how weak they are. Rayne sighs...

line.text: Even with The Void vanquished, the Elementals are restless. Something stirs them into a frenzy. Some unknown power...

mission.name: Relentless Elementals
mission.desc: The elementals converge from the skies, the walls, and the floor. They reach towards Rayne, trying desperately to grasp onto one of her water-like tendrils.

mission.name: Nothing But Dust
mission.desc: Rayne checks the ground where the Elementals have fallen. Nothing remains except a chalky dust, as if the Elementals have turned into ash.

line.text: It seems we have come here for nothing. The Elementals behave the same here as above ground. The source of their disturbance yet eludes us.

mission.name: The Good News
mission.desc: Rayne finishes inspecting the residue, turning back towards the town. For the last three days, you and Rayne have been staying in the village of Beetleton Bunker.

line.text: My apologies, our efforts were not completely wasted. After all, your friends at Beetleton Bunker want to give you a proper celebration.

mission.name: From Adventurer to Hero
mission.desc: The two of you travel towards the Insect Village. The normally drab town has been decorated in colorful banners. After sealing away The Void, you have been hailed as a hero.

mission.name: Fan Club
mission.desc: A troop of Insects waits for you at the gate of Beetleton. As you and Rayne near, they begin to bounce up and down excitedly, cheering you on.

line.text: Hero! Hero! It wouldn't be right for you to be late to your own party!
You're certainly popular now, aren't you?

mission.name: Hero Worship
mission.desc: You are mobbed by adoring fans of the six-legged variety. Their sticky hands push you forward, perhaps with too much energy, as they hustle you towards the town plaza.

line.text: My name's Dilbert. Your friends were already heroes of Beetleton Bunker.
But now, you're heroes of the whole world.

mission.name: Unease
mission.desc: You can feel eyes on your back. You turn around towards the wilderness outside of Beetleton Bunker. You think you see something, but it vanishes too quickly for you to make out clearly.

mission.name: Party Celebration
mission.desc: Dilbert and the rest of the insects eventually get you to the town plaza. The decorations of banners and streamers help give some color to the town, but you notice the buffet table is lined with slimy substances. It might be wise to avoid eating anything.

mission.name: Mechas of Beetleton
mission.desc: Dilbert points to a mechanical creation. It is shaped similar to their insect brethren, but made of steel and mechanical wheels. Saws are poised above its head, as it works steadily on party decorations.

line.text: Oh, have you not seen our helpers before? We assembled them to do work for us.
We call them... mechas.

mission.name: Diligent Workers
mission.desc: The machines work together with eerie proficiency. Their knives and saws hit the wood in harmony, creating a perfect rhythm. One mecha stops, red eyes turning towards you.

line.text: The mecha have helped us rebuild from the goblins' attacks. We wouldn't be able to host a party like this without them.

mission.name: Mecha Encounter
mission.desc: The mecha insect's wheels squeak as it stops its work, rolling up to you. For an uncomfortable amount of time, it stares at you with its red eyes. And then... it speaks.

line.text: Bzzt.... YOU ARE THE ONE. THE VANQUISHER OF THE VOID.
DIE!

mission.name: Robot Encounter
mission.desc: The mechanical beetle swings at you. The other mecha workers stop, red eyes all fixating on you. Then they begin to roll closer, wielding their saws and work tools.

mission.name: The Mecha Uprising
mission.desc: It's an uprising of mechas! Behind you, Dilbert and the other Beetleton Insects panic. They run around shrieking, pointing at their former helpers.

line.text: What's going on?! What's happening?!?
It looks like we will be the ones to help, again. Let's take care of this before things get worse.

mission.name: Cleansing Waves
mission.desc: Rayne brings her waters against the mechanical creatures, which fizzle beneath the waves. You continue to clear out the mechas, who seem content to ignore the innocent Insects, and focus their attention on you.

mission.name: Damaged Celebration
mission.desc: The last of the foes are defeated. But the damage to the plaza has been done. The decorations have been washed away. You're secretly glad that the buffet table didn't survive.

line.text: Omigosh, I'm so sorry. They've never behaved this way before. It should be impossible...

mission.name: Unknown Restlessness
mission.desc: You, Rayne, Dilbert, and the Insects begin the long cleanup process. The Insects insist that they can take care of the cleaning themselves, but it is far too much for any one person to handle.

line.text: Even with The Void's defeat, not everything is right. The spirits of the elements are restless. The mechanical creatures move of their own will... Just what is going on?

mission.name: Fighting Insects
mission.desc: As you continue to pick up, you feel eyes on your back again. Turning around, you see nothing. But before you can resume your cleaning, a bug has approached you. But there's something off... He doesn't look like the Beetleton Bunker Insects. Suddenly, he lunges and attacks!

mission.name: Feral Foes
mission.desc: A small group of Insects has cornered you, viciously attacking both you and Rayne. Dilbert panics again, as he and the other bugs flee in terror.

line.text: HISSSSSSS!
Feral bugs! Look out!

mission.name: Insect Beasts
mission.desc: The insect beasts attack anything in their path. Unlike the mechas, the insects attack whatever they can reach. Their eyes lack the spark of intelligence that the Insects of Beetleton possess.

mission.name: Bane of Beetleton
mission.desc: The beasts fall beneath the effort of you and Rayne. Dilbert and the other Beetleton Bunker Insects emerge from hiding. Dilbert once again apologizes profusely.

line.text: Feral bugs have been our enemies for many years. They're nothing but mindless beasts. I'm so sorry, I don't know how they got in here.

mission.name: Strange Coincidences
mission.desc: Rayne gently leads you to the side. She speaks quietly, hiding her words from the group of Insects behind you.

line.text: First the mechas, now the feral bugs. This is too much to all be one coincidence.
Someone must be orchestrating this. Let's investigate.

mission.name: Blind Blame
mission.desc: The Assassin orders those around him to attack. Although his voice remains calm, you can see how his sword arm trembles. For everything in this world that has changed, he now blames you...

mission.name: Opposite Spectrums
mission.desc: When you try to explain yourself, to defend all the actions you took and the freedom that you brought, he stops you. For this freedom was not one he wished for. With just one purpose of revenge, his quest has ended, and yet he has no one waiting for him to return home.

mission.name: War Life
mission.desc: As such, the only life he knows is one of fighting. There is no place for him in this new world of peace. If no trouble exists, then he shall create it. He vows to gather all your enemies, all the people you have trampled upon to reach your position.

mission.name: Bitter Promises
mission.desc: For while you have created many friends in your quest to defeat The Void, so too have you made many enemies. The Assassin sends the remaining Insects against you, before slipping into the night.

mission.name: The End of a Thought
mission.desc: After separating from Rayne, you take a closer look around for the one who sabotaged the mecha insects, and who likely lured the feral bugs into Beetleton Bunker. Your search revealed an old friend, with whom you dealt with privately.

mission.name: Resolved Differences
mission.desc: You meet up with Rayne and explained what happened. It seems like for now, your troubles with the mech and feral bugs should be settled, now that The Assassin has fled.

line.text: It's sad when former allies turn to desperate measures. Let us hope that The Assassin does not return.

mission.name: Ally Reunion
mission.desc: The next day, you have helped the Insects salvage their festival. Emisarries from foreign lands have gathered, and you recognize a great many faces, and see some new ones.

line.text: Long time no see, adventurer. You've come so far since I last saw you, rescuing those dragon hatchlings.
Oh hohoho. You've gotten a little taller since our time in Duskwillow, I do believe.
Have you been eating properly? Are those rings around your eyes? Make sure to rest properly!

mission.name: Frigore Allies
mission.desc: You spend some time mingling with your friends from afar. Most of your friends who helped you reached The Void Plane have also come to celebrate. Among them you spy Malchior and Tarian.

line.text: Ahh, the Beetleton's infamous funnel cake. Naturally it's only for the sake of science that piques my interest.
...Are you certain that is a funnel cake?
Well there's no flour or eggs in this, I'll tell you that much!

mission.name: Former Enemies
mission.desc: To your surprise, you see someone you did not expect to arrive at the party. The proud Aether leader remains at the festival's fringe. Although he's unwilling to step near the dance floor, his presence still speaks to your victory against The Void.

mission.name: The Aether Leader's Respect
mission.desc: You approach Samael to speak with him, unable to leave him sulking in the corner. Besides, he looks a little lonely, without any other friends at the festival.

line.text: What is it? You are surprised that I would honor someone who sealed The Void?
Although our methods differed, I do not deny your accomplishment. The Void was the ultimate threat. Once more, Order has a chance of restoring this broken world.

mission.name: Farewell to Dyrnwyn
mission.desc: Taking out Dyrnwyn, whose flame has grown cold since leaving The Void Plane, you offer it to Samael. You have sensed that the sword will no longer aid you, perhaps because it believes you strong enough without its power.

line.text: You... would return Dyrnwyn to me? Even though the sword chose you?
... Thank you. It was not until the sword was gone, that I realized I ignored its call. This time... I will listen to when it reaches to my heart.

mission.name: Silent Stars
mission.desc: You leave Samael to his thoughts, and instead you wander through the quiet sections of town. Deep below the earth's surface, looking up you can see cracks in the earthen dome. Far, far up are the stars, faint light slowly streaming to touch the ground...

mission.name: Peaceful World
mission.desc: While you are looking at the stars, Elyse joins you. She watches the stars for a few minutes, the two of you in silence, until finally she speaks...

line.text: It doesn't feel real... does it? The world is safe now.

mission.name: Bluefire's Prophecy
mission.desc: Elyse confesses a concern she's had for some time. The journey to The Void Plane was hard on all of you, and some doubts still remain...

line.text: I just keep thinking about Bluefire's last words. He seemed so certain that without The Void, the tribes would turn on each other.

mission.name: Peace Shattered
mission.desc: Elyse is still talking, when you hear something that sounds like an explosion! It came from the party area. Perhaps one of the Insects' mechanical creatures has gone awry again?

line.text: I'm sorry. This is supposed to be a celebration and I-
Wait, did you hear that explosion?! Quick, back to the main square!

mission.name: Growing Trouble
mission.desc: You and Elyse rush towards the party, but somewhere in the crowd, you end up losing sight of her. There's no time to stop and search. The celebration had been thinning when you last wandered off, but there are far too many people who have gathered...

mission.name: Party Crashers
mission.desc: It's difficult to make out all the forms in the darkness, until you draw close. You find that the party-goers are retreating from a group of goblins!

line.text: Party! Party! Look at these great BOMBS we brought as gifts!

mission.name: Party Control
mission.desc: Fiona and Rayne, having experience in dealing with goblins, are already deep within their ranks and fighting. You struggle to catch up to them before they become out of reach entirely.

line.text: You picked the wrong party to crash, goblins!

mission.name: Firework Destruction
mission.desc: You fight through the looting goblins, who have begun smashing the party decorations that the Insects worked so hard to create. Firework explosions flash in the sky, the goblins doing everything they can to induce chaos.

mission.name: Joint Effort
mission.desc: Finally you manage to clear your way to the center of the fiercest fighting, joining Fiona and Rayne as they hold the goblins back. You can see that some distance away, an airship has landed, likely how the goblins invaded with such short notice.

line.text: There you are. Come, let us deal with these nuisances.

mission.name: Goblin Revenge
mission.desc: You continue to fight through the hoards of goblins. That is, until a goblin with wild hair steps forward. The other goblins part, letting her approach your group.

line.text: Well lookee here, if it ain't the blond lass that had it out fer my bro.
Bro? I mean, brother? Wait, who are you...

mission.name: A Vengeful Sister
mission.desc: The mysterious goblin seems to be blaming your friend for something. She has an unpleasant grin across her face, while the smaller goblins shout in anger...

line.text: Aye, the name's Xerkahn, an' you're responsible for the death of my li'l bro Reks! Did you forget him so soon?
An' now you all are havin' a party, yet conveniently didn't invite us goblins, eh.
It's not fair, not fair!

mission.name: Mecha Dragons
mission.desc: Xerkahn snarls, motioning for the goblins towards the ship. They wheel out strange creations, more mechanical creatures that have the shape of dragons, that join the fray and attack!

mission.name: Rise to Defend
mission.desc: The goblins and mecha are clearly concentrating their attacks on Fiona, seeking to overwhelm her. But you and Rayne leap to her aid, distracting the goblin forces long enough for her to mount her own offense!

mission.name: The Missing Tribe
mission.desc: The goblin looters scan the fleeing crowd and those who have stood up to fight. Samael and his angels, along with some of the others, have engaged the goblins in Beetleton. The goblins seem to be looking for something...

line.text: Captain! Did ya notice? Not ALL the tribes are here. There's another that's missing!
Aye. It's safe to say they prob ain't allies, then. And an enemy of my enemy is a potential ally!

mission.name: Thieving Forces
mission.desc: A group of goblins bursts through the main plaza, running past the chaos and joining Xerkahn in her fight. One is carrying something wrapped in cloth, the contents hidden from your eyes.

line.text: The vault's empty, Captain! They musta moved the Spellstone Hammer somewhere else.
Ya fools! I told you not to come back empty-handed!
We ain't empty-handed, Captain!

mission.name: Thieving Forces
mission.desc: Elyse struggles to catch up, in pursuit of the goblins who have rendezvoused with Xerkahn. Her pace is slowed by a limp, yet she hurries as quickly as she can...

line.text: Adventurer, stop them! They've stolen the Seastone Staff!

mission.name: Sky Pirates
mission.desc: The goblins and Xerkahn retreat to their airship. The mecha beasts stay behind, preventing you from continuing your chase! Xerkahn grabs a rope on the side of the ship, while her men haul her on board. She waves and laughs loudly...

line.text: Tah-tah! Don't worry, I'm sure we'll meet again soon, and with an army of all yer worst enemies!
Next time, try to invite more tribes to some celebration that's supposed to be for everyone, eh?!

mission.name: Aftermath
mission.desc: The airship pirates have already left. Remnant fires burn in Beetleton, the party decorations again destroyed. At the very least it doesn't look like anyone was seriously injured...

line.text: Ugh... Is it over?
They got away with the Seastone Staff... We can't let them do whatever they want.
They weren't exactly subtle with their plan. Some of us will pursue them, while the rest remain here to help the Insects of Beetleton.

mission.name: Ancient Technology
mission.desc: Pharos Temple is extremely dark and silent. Yet when exposed to electric jellyfish, the machines hum to life. You collect more, seeking to revive the ancient technology of the temple.

mission.name: Jellyfish Power
mission.desc: The Temple's technology can be directed to aid you in fights around the perimeter of Pharos. Using the power from the jellyfish, you spur the previously inactive machines to do your bidding.

mission.name: Seafolk Parley
mission.desc: At Rayne's suggestion, you have returned to Duskwillow. Donning swimming gear, you head out of the bay and into the ocean, where you plunge deep beneath the waters.

line.text: Xerkahn must be planning to get the Seafolk tribe to aid her cause. We should speak with the King and assure the Seafolk of our good intentions.

mission.name: Return of the Plunderers
mission.desc: While traversing from the bay to the ocean, a familiar face blocks your path. Zolmosh has with him a host of seafolk!

line.text: ZOLMOSH FIST... SMASH!
It's just as the goblins warned! The heretics who stopped Lady Scylla's awakening are now trying to invade our waters!

mission.name: Invasion Remnants
mission.desc: You fight against the same invaders of Duskwillow. They are joined by other merfolk and fish, and among their ranks you even see goblins that are wearing makeshift sea gear of their own...

mission.name: Return of the Pirates
mission.desc: Past the ranks of seafolk, you spy familiar pink hair. Xerkahn and her goblins are trying to shuffle off in the fighting, but you stop them before they manage to run again.

line.text: Grr, persistent buggers, I can't believe you caught up!

mission.name: Sea Goblins
mission.desc: The goblins' gear looks like it was put together hastily. You're not entirely certain how some of them are able to breathe with just fish bowls over their heads, but they are still determined to follow Xerkahn's orders.

line.text: I don't got time for this! Men, keep 'em busy!
Yes Captain!

mission.name: Raiders and Pirates
mission.desc: Even with a hastily constructed alliance, the seafolk and goblins work with surprising efficiency. The seafolk plow through at the front ranks, while the goblins provide support fire behind them.

mission.name: War Prevention
mission.desc: By the time you manage to clear a path, Xerkahn has already managed to escape again. The remaining goblin and seafolk forces flee from your presence, or as well as they can, the goblins paddling in place and not moving very quickly.

line.text: Sigh. While I would love to pursue Xerkahn to retrieve the staff, finding the King is our top priority.
We cannot allow this to escalate into a full war against an entire tribe.

mission.name: In Search of a King
mission.desc: Rayne corners one of the seafolk who made the unfortunate blunder of swimming straight into a goblin. She pulls the merfolk man back, who cowers beneath her fierce gaze.

line.text: Inform us of where we can speak with your king.
Fshhh, the King has gone to Pharos Temple! That's all I know!

mission.name: A Prayer for the Godless
mission.desc: Rayne releases the kraken, allowing him to flee. She seems unhappy with the turn of events.

line.text: Hmm, odd that the king would be visiting a temple. Hopefully he's not a follower of Scylla, or we may have a problem on our hands.

mission.name: Sea Temple
mission.desc: The two of you follow the underwater path, which Rayne believes will go to the Temple. It doesn't take long to find. Amidst the seaweed forest, you find the crumbling image of a temple.

mission.name: Scylla's Devout
mission.desc: Zolmosh and his forces have returned! They desperately seek to prevent you from entering sacred ground. However as you begin to fight, another group of Seafolk emerge from the Temple.

line.text: We are not too late! Reclaim the Temple; let none stop us!

mission.name: Seafolk Soldiers
mission.desc: Massive chaos ensues as the Seafolk fight against Zolmosh and his raiders. However, they also turn and point their spears against you and Rayne!

mission.name: Seafolk King
mission.desc: From the temple's crumbled doors, a fierce-looking Merman emerges. The other Seafolk part their ranks, giving him a path to speak to you.

line.text: Why have you come to our sacred temple?

mission.name: Mixed Factions
mission.desc: You and Rayne explain why you have traveled all the way under the sea. The merman introduces himself as the King of the Seafolk, stroking his beard thoughtfully...

line.text: I am the King of the Sea, King Proteus. Those pitiful raiders who attacked Duskwillow are no allies of ours...

mission.name: Repurposed Staff
mission.desc: Rayne notices something that the Seafolk King is carrying. But the rest of the Seafolk grow tense when Rayne points it out, some even grabbing their weapons.

line.text: Is that... the Seastone Staff you're carrying?
It's just as the goblins said. They've come for the staff. Seize them!
Wait!

mission.name: Soldier Squabble
mission.desc: The guards that were with the Seafolk King raise their tridents, battling their might against yours. Despite your hurry, it seems the goblins were able to speak with the King before you, and convinced them to fight...

mission.name: Outsider Suspicion
mission.desc: The fighting continues, while Rayne tries to negotiate. However, the Seafolk are hesitant to listen, refusing to trust someone interested in treasure...

line.text: Calm yourself. We have come with the intention of peace.
If you've come with the intention of parley, you should have thought twice before making demands.

mission.name: Relentless Negotiations
mission.desc: Rayne refuses to stop trying. Failing here could spark a war between the Seafolk and the other tribes. The two of you endure everything that the Seafolk throw at you.

line.text: How can we convince you that we wish to be allies?

mission.name: A Proposal
mission.desc: The Seafolk King considers your words. He tells you about the Temple, and why he has come to a place distant from his own city.

line.text: Hmm, so you wish to prove yourself. So be it. The power to our main city has gone out.
We have arrived here to restore the power supply, which will also activate the Temple's defenses. Aid us, and we might consider your words.

mission.name: Gathering Energy
mission.desc: With a new mission in mind, you and Rayne leave the Seafolk King. Palm-sized jellyfish hover in the sea, which when gathered, emit a charge of electricity.

mission.name: Reviving Technology
mission.desc: You begin the long task of re-assembling the Temple's security system. A few stray goblins and Seafolk raiders remain, trying to stop you from completing your task.

line.text: I suppose we should have asked... Just what exactly is this a temple dedicated to?

mission.name: Energy Restoration
mission.desc: When you're able to supply at least some power back to the temple's defenses, you return to King Proteus. He has waited, as promised.

line.text: The defense system will require more energy to reboot completely. But it should be enough to help your people, King Proteus.
Good.

mission.name: The Guardian's Cries
mission.desc: Rumbling shakes deep within the temple. Even the Seafolk guards have trouble keeping their balance with their fins. Something monstrous shrieks from the Temple...

line.text: Now what was THAT?
The guardian of the Pharos Temple is awakening...

mission.name: The Guardian's Fury
mission.desc: Tentacles reach out from the temple, stretching towards you and Rayne! The Seafolk King and his men flee from the creature, leaving you to handle it.

line.text: Guardian, we mean no harm to the Temple!
That thing can't distinguish friend from foe. Let's beat it!

mission.name: Drum of War
mission.desc: Xerkahn sneers at you and the Seafolk King. At the worst possible time, Zolmosh has returned with an army of Seafolk. Swearing to take revenge for her fallen brother, Xerkahn leads the attack!

mission.name: Seaship Attack
mission.desc: A large shadow creeps over you and the Seafolk forces. A steel encased ship whirs as its propellers spin, bringing it closer, while a black flag with a skull insignia flutters in the waves...

mission.name: Cannon Barrage
mission.desc: Metal plates slide as a sleek cannon emerges near the submarine's hull. The rest of the ship grows more cannons, pointed to the fray. Xerkahn shrieks for them to attack, the sea floor peppered with fierce explosions.

mission.name: Consuming Vengeance
mission.desc: The cannons cannot possibly distinguish between forces when yours are so entwined with Xerkahn's. Friend and foe alike are hit with the barrage, Xerkahn's hysterical laughter ringing above the fire, even as it eventually consumes her...

mission.name: The Heart Trembles...
mission.desc: At long last, you are able to return to Dawnglow Swamp, in search of the Seastone Staff, where the Frog Emperor has gathered all of his tribe. They beat steadily on drums, creating a heart-pounding rhythm. Frog Warriors dance, the ground painted with a strange symbol...

mission.name: Mortality Ascends...
mission.desc: In the Emperor's hands is the Seastone Staff! The drums stop abruptly, the dancers ceasing their frantic movements. A beat of silence, and then the earth rumbles. In the distance, lifting a block of earth, is a golden giant standing taller than Dawnglow's ancient tree...

mission.name: Desires Constrict...
mission.desc: The Frog Emperor beseeches the giant, 'We have lost so much to those in greater power. Protect us, protect our children, and take vengeance upon those who thought they could act with impunity.' And he points straight at you...

mission.name: Boundaries Liberated
mission.desc: The giant speaks: 'I am Viracocha, constructed to guard life and death. For it takes a being that is neither alive nor dead to impartially judge who lives and dies. Adventurer, you will tell me. Am I strong enough to become a titan? Now come, and let us fight...'

mission.name: Guarding Against a Guardian
mission.desc: The guardian had turned against everything in its path. However, you protected the Seafolk King from being attacked, even after his guards fell.

mission.name: Proven Intentions
mission.desc: The Seafolk King reluctantly acknowledges your part in protecting him. The guardian lays dead on the sea bed, a testament to your strength.

line.text: You have proven yourself to be a true ally. If you had wanted to attack us, there would have been no better time than when the guardian attacked.

mission.name: Negotiation Revival
mission.desc: With the Temple's threat neutralized, Rayne believes it's time to further negotiations with the Seafolk. The King just might listen this time.

line.text: Thank you, King Proteus. I would like to establish better communication between the Seafolk tribe and the rest of Arcantica.

mission.name: Hesitant Acceptance
mission.desc: The King finally seems to trust you, albeit reluctantly. His hands curl protectively over the Seastone staff, which he's hesitant to give up to you.

line.text: The Seastone Staff is an artifact forged from another ocean. But I understand it was gifted to an Order of Monks.
We would not be in possession of it if it hadn't been stolen. I understand this. And yet...

mission.name: Unexpected Marauders
mission.desc: Before you can continue your conversation with the King about the Seastone Staff, a soldier swims quickly to the King's side. Despite his whispering, you can still hear the soldier's words...

line.text: My liege! Our forces are under attack by the waters of Duskwillow!
What?! Who dares!

mission.name: A Friend in Need
mission.desc: The Seafolk King swims off before you and Rayne can continue your discussion. Rayne gives chase, urging you to do the same.

line.text: Just when we were making progress. Come, adventurer, let's see if they need our help.

mission.name: Looming Threat
mission.desc: You swim as quickly as you can, trying to catch up with the faster Seafolk. A shadow descends from above you, something swimming closer...

mission.name: Dawnglow War Life
mission.desc: It's frogs! You can see from their colorful attire that they must be from Dawnglow Swamp. Unlike the peaceful Golden Leaf frogs, the Dawnglow tribe hasn't always been friendly towards you... and now they seem ready to fight!

line.text: Rrribbit! Take no prisoners!

mission.name: Frog Fighters
mission.desc: You and Rayne quickly work to dispatch the small force of frogs. You hurry to where you saw King Proteus swimming...

mission.name: Crossfire
mission.desc: On the other side of Pharos Temple, you find that the King and his men are engaged with a battalion of frogs. When you get closer, you become trapped in the crossfire!

line.text: Stop this fighting, now! What are these Dawnglow frogs even doing here?!

mission.name: War Stratagem
mission.desc: You realize that the Seafolk that are fighting with you aren't actually the King's men. It seems that the Oracle of Scylla has returned, fighting the frogs under the guise of protecting the King!

mission.name: Stubborn King
mission.desc: Rayne has noticed the discrepancy as well. She pulls you and the King Proteus to the side, away from the main fray. She has a plan of her own...

line.text: King Proteus, I believe you might be in danger. I want you and the adventurer to flee.
What? My men and I are not afraid to face danger!

mission.name: True Colors
mission.desc: At Rayne's urging, you take the King's hand and try to drag him away. He resists, and you can't make it very far before one of the raiders notices your plight.

line.text: Hold it, King Proteus. You're not allowed to leave!

mission.name: Seafolk Versus Seafolk
mission.desc: The King looks ready to take out the raiders by himself. If you can't calm him down, the next best thing to do is to fight alongside him.

line.text: What is the meaning of this?!
The Dawnglow frogs are furious that your forces assaulted their sister clan in Duskwillow.
Fiend, you know perfectly well that's a result of your actions!

mission.name: Seastone Staff's Power
mission.desc: King Proteus wants to take care of the raiders by himself. He prepares to finish off Zolmosh and his crew...

line.text: Stand aside, adventurer. I'll use the Seastone Staff to vanquish these frauds!

mission.name: Empty Promises
mission.desc: The King points the staff dramatically at the Oracle of Scylla. Yet nothing happens. He shakes the staff, while the enemy forces close in.

mission.name: Fake Seastone Staff
mission.desc: You jump into the battle in order to protect the King. He seems completely distracted with his staff, which refuses to work no matter what position he holds it in.

line.text: This staff... it's a fake! Find her! Find the goblin pirate who dares make fun of us!

mission.name: A Friend Indeed
mission.desc: Rayne is forced to intervene again. The two of you have not fled nearly far enough, despite her earlier promptings. The frogs are beginning to catch up...

line.text: I'll take care of the Dawnglow frogs. You go ahead and help the King. We'll need to find Xerkahn to get the real Seastone Staff...

mission.name: Under Her Thumb
mission.desc: You search for the Seastone Staff, keeping close to the King. Rayne drags the attention of the frogs away from you. Meanwhile, you confront the Seafolk raiders, who you saw working with Xerkahn earlier...

line.text: Ack! You win. Okay, I'll tell you where the pirate goblin went...

mission.name: Best Laid Plans
mission.desc: The raiders tell you about Xerkahn. They were supposed to meet after the issue with the King and the Dawnglow frogs had been resolved. Xerkahn will likely be there waiting...

mission.name: Pirates of All Types
mission.desc: You return to Pharos Temple, where you find Xerkahn waiting with a host of Seafolk pirates. It seems her crew is ready to fight!

line.text: Well if it ain't the prim an' proper King along with the riffraff adventurer!

mission.name: Intimidation
mission.desc: The Seafolk King doesn't have great negotiation skills. After being duped by the goblin pirate, King Proteus clearly wants a fight.

line.text: I'll give you one chance to explain why you handed me a fake staff. And I fully expect you to return the genuine article.

mission.name: Master Plan
mission.desc: Xerkahn reveals her master plan, which involves both the Dawnglow frogs and the entire Seafolk kingdom. There's just one problem...

line.text: Aye, I see you've figured it out. The Dawnglow frogs were quick to mount a counter-offense in retaliation of Duskwillow.
They only needed to have the right incentive... a gift that showed our sincerity an' goodwill...

mission.name: Plan of Attack
mission.desc: Xerkahn ends the conversation. She still has other plans in mind, one of which involves the Seafolk King.

line.text: Why would I give a powerful artifact to a dead man?
Enough talkin', Kingie. You've got a bit o' dying to do. Then the Seafolk will be quick to hate the allied tribes!

mission.name: King Proteus's Answer
mission.desc: King Proteus is quick to give Xerkahn an answer. The Seafolk pirates rally behind the Goblin pirate, the two combining to form an unlikely but devastating alliance.

line.text: If it's a war you're after, then it's a war you'll get!

mission.name: Fireshard Power
mission.desc: Although the Chaos of Karthos originally hoped to find the Heart of Blue Fire, they instead found the mine to be a valuable resource of Fireshards. You have taken to collecting stray Fireshards, using them to recharge arcane ore infused with magical properties.

mission.name: Fireshard Energy
mission.desc: The Fireshards are actually cool beneath a human's touch, but their name comes from their appearance. The stones radiate with energy inside them, lights dancing like firework sparklers.

mission.name: Fireshard Mine's History
mission.desc: After witnessing the strange automaton technology in Pharos Temple, you've heard more reports of similar technology in a place called Fireshard Mine. Along with Aria, the two of you have been sent to investigate a possible connection between the mechas and goblins.

line.text: Long ago, the Chaos thought they could find the Heart of Blue Fire in this mine.
But we were clearly mistaken. The mine was abandoned when we realized the cache was nothing more than a pile of Fireshards.

mission.name: Product of Karthos
mission.desc: Minecart railways snake down the strip mine, twisting off into tunnels and dead-ends. Although she gets turned around once, Aria leads with a certainty that speaks of her familiarity of the land.

mission.name: Recently Abandoned
mission.desc: The railway shows sign of use, glistening metal unhidden by dust or rocky film. The path downward continues unobstructed by roadblocks, making it fairly easy to continue in a relatively straight line.

line.text: For being an abandoned mine, there's an odd amount of recent activity...

mission.name: Heavy Metal
mission.desc: As the two of you descend, mechanical creations shuffle out of the tunnels. One leads the approach, a mecha with lava oozing from his center like a furnace, shoulders ablaze with fire.

line.text: Intruders!! Dragging their feet all across our land, so I've come to offer reprimand, this is insult we shall not withstand!
Wait, what?

mission.name: Scyer of Fire
mission.desc: The mechas clank towards you at the burning Mecha's signal. It seems that they are unhappy to have uninvited visitors...

line.text: The name's Scyer, prepare to expire, burn up in fire!
This is wonderful. Just our luck. Let's just beat them up and be on our way.

mission.name: Not Among the Living
mission.desc: The mechanical creatures fight unlike anything else you've previously fought. They swing without regard to the damage they might receive in return, something about their mindless gaze and frantic attacks reminding you of the Undead...

mission.name: Mecha Reinforcements
mission.desc: Even as you add more of the mecha creatures to the scrap pile, more continue to emerge from the tunnels. Their reinforcements seem endless.

line.text: There's too many of them. Look, do you see that minecart? Let's run for it!

mission.name: Minecart Escape
mission.desc: Shoving off one mecha who was content to use the minecart as a bed, you hop into the escape vehicle. Aria pushes the cart to gain a little momentum, before joining you inside of it.

mission.name: Mecha Mayhem
mission.desc: The angry mecha latches onto the cart, trying with all his might to grind your progress to a halt! With one last whack, you send the burning mecha tumbling to the ground.

line.text: Undignified beep! That was just cheap! Now if only I could leap...

mission.name: Quick Getaway
mission.desc: The cart picks up more momentum as it descends into the mine's depths. Faster and faster the wheels spin, careening dangerously as it threatens to tip over!

line.text: That was close. But now we face a different problem.
How do we stop this thing?!

mission.name: Too Quick Getaway
mission.desc: The cart hits a bump, catapulting you and Aria dangerously through the air! By some miracle the ground you land on has been sifted vigorously, the sand absorbing most of the impact, albeit leaving you with a few scratches.

mission.name: Steel Company
mission.desc: As you pick yourself up, you feel the presence of others nearby. Metallic footsteps echo eerily throughout the strip mine. They are getting closer, eyes on you and Aria...

line.text: Don't fall asleep on me now, adventurer. It looks like we have company...

mission.name: Mine Dwellers
mission.desc: The shell of a gigantic mecha lays in ruins. Its head is nowhere to be found, vegetation snaking up along its immobile limbs. Mechas, not unlike the ones that attacked you, approach you and Aria...

line.text: *Beep*, surface dwellers have arrived as guests.

mission.name: Loss of Protocol
mission.desc: You stop Aria from offering a snippy reply, and instead attempt to talk to the mechas. Unlike the ones at the mine's entrance, these ones seem more peaceful. You explain your plight with Scyer.

line.text: Warden Scyer's primary protocol has altered upon the loss of his thermometer.
Without the thermometer to regulate his temperature, he frequently overheats upon encountering any unknown variable.

mission.name: Singular Intent
mission.desc: Before you can protest, Aria shoves you to the side and questions the Mechas intently. Even with the unexpected company, her goal remains the same... to find out who is aiding the goblins in their quest for war.

line.text: You're the ones responsible for providing resources to the goblins, aren't you.
*Bleep, blip?*
Don't try that innocent act on me, scrap metal. Your boss just nearly killed us.

mission.name: Hesitant Mechas
mission.desc: The mechas back away from Aria. It seems despite the violent encounter with the other mechas, these ones prefer a more peaceful resolution - but certainly aren't opposed to fighting back!

mission.name: Mecha Madness
mission.desc: Aria's attempt to negotiate only spurs the mechas into fighting! With their drill hands, they launch themselves at you and attack!

line.text: Error. Communication breakdown.
No, you piles of rust. I keep telling you-
Initiating sequence: self-preservation.

mission.name: Soothing Words
mission.desc: Shoving Aria out of the way again, you attempt to talk with the mechas once more. Their drill hands stop whirling, eyes transitioning from a dangerous red to a peaceful blue.

mission.name: The Plight of Mecha Miners
mission.desc: At last, the mechas calm down enough to continue their earlier talk. You express your interest in returning Scyer back to his previous state, and request more information about his thermometer.

line.text: Yes, Warden Scyer's thermometer. It fell to the deepest part of the mine.
We do not go down there. Never.

mission.name: Hidden Dangers
mission.desc: Aria keeps her distance from the mechas, but can't help but interrupt. She is certain the solution cannot be so simple...

line.text: And is there a reason for that? A reason that we should know?

mission.name: Truth of the Mine
mission.desc: The mecha miner explains why the thermometer has been missing so long. The mecha points down to a deeper region of the mine, one that is cloaked in darkness...

line.text: *Beep* A terrible creature lives down there. Those who venture down there beep loudly, of a monster that melts metal.
No one has ever returned.

mission.name: A Robot's Dreams
mission.desc: The Mecha Miner watches you with a light in its eyes that could only be described as hopeful. They seem content to wait for however long it takes...

mission.name: Lovable Scrap Heaps
mission.desc: Aria shrugs, seeming to relent. She looks to you to make the final decision on the matter, while the mecha continue to wait patiently.

line.text: Well, if you want to help them, I guess I'll come with you. It would be better for these scrap heaps to like us than want to war with all people everywhere.

mission.name: A Warning Sign
mission.desc: You descend into the depths of the mine. Aria lights a torch, chasing back the shadows that grow only fiercer and larger the farther you descend. A low moan echoes eerily throughout the mine, the source somewhere ahead of you...

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: One mecha tells Warden Scyer about the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. And also his curse...

line.text: Yo trick or treat, gimme something fun to eat!
*Beep, bop* Warden Scyer, cool your initiative. Do you not know the legend of Pumpking?

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance
mission.desc: Whoever says Pumpking's name is rumored to see the ghost of Pumpking. Scyer scoffs at the legend, daring to take Pumpking's name in vain...

line.text: I say Pumpking, Pumpking, I sing! Whoever say his name thrice, they gonna pay the price-
Pumpking?!

mission.name: More Treat Than Trick
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays a hollowed pumpkin by Scyer's feet, filled with bright wrappers inside it. The ghost turns, fading into the night...

line.text: Yeow!
I thought I was in a bind, but candy was all he left behind!

mission.name: Buried Alive
mission.desc: The earth trembles. The gigantic Mecha which seemed dormant is still functional! It lifts itself from the ground, turning to face you...

mission.name: Remnant Fireshards
mission.desc: The silent Mecha teeters uncertainly. Cracks run across its body, the weight of time still heavy upon its limbs. Chunks of fireshards stick to its body, infusing it with just enough energy to fight.

mission.name: Powering Down
mission.desc: The Fireshards snap, falling off as the Mecha continues to fight. Its body loses a little bit of glow each time it loses a crystal.

mission.name: To Fight a Giant
mission.desc: Aria shouts encouragement while the other Mechas flee from being crushed underfoot. The mechanical beast swings at you one last time, continuing its task with mindless efficiency.

mission.name: Call of the Haunted
mission.desc: The original voice you heard earlier has since become silent. For a few seconds you can only hear the footsteps of Aria and yourself. Then, multiple voices begin to groan, in eerie succession...

line.text: I'd recognize the cries of the Undead anywhere. Get ready for a fight.

mission.name: Yearning for the Light
mission.desc: The light from Aria's torch reveals the battered form of a skeleton! Behind it are more undead, drawn to the light like moths to a flame.

mission.name: Fallen Fighters
mission.desc: The Undead fall upon the two of you with avid hunger. Alone in the depths of the mine, they rarely get the chance to find visitors that aren't encased in metal.

line.text: This behavior isn't natural. There must be something controlling these Undead.

mission.name: Undead Expertise
mission.desc: Aria forges a path through the clumps of Undead forces. Trusting her expertise in matters of the Undead, you aid her efforts and follow her lead.

line.text: See how their path follows a similar line, like how ants follow each other's footsteps in search of food?
If we trace that path to their origin, we should be able to stop the flow of Undead.

mission.name: Undead Pathfinder
mission.desc: Aria's path leads you through the heart of the Undead. Their numbers become greater despite the many that you have taken out, their hands reaching out to claw against you!

mission.name: Siren Call
mission.desc: Aria pauses in the fighting. She holds up one hand, motioning for you to listen. You can hear a groan, the same voice that you heard when you first descended into the mine's depths.

line.text: Ungh.... UNNNNNNNGH!

mission.name: Amiable Ooze
mission.desc: A fearsome looking creature emerges from the ground. Its body is like a puddle of acid, its form bubbling and fizzling unnaturally. As you prepare to fight it, the ooze creature instead turns and fights the Undead!

line.text: NO! Bad zombies, very bad zombies. Do not scare away potential suitors!

mission.name: Galya, the Acid Elemental
mission.desc: The army diminishes beneath the might of your new ally. With the zombies out of the way, she turns back to you and Aria, sinking back into a puddle appearance.

line.text: I am Galya, the acid Elemental. Welcome to my lovely makeshift abode.
You LIVE down here, in the dark with the Undead?

mission.name: In Search of Love
mission.desc: Galya explains her purpose, seeming not to mind the Undead remnants which occasionally give you trouble. They ignore her completely, focusing on you.

line.text: Yes... for now... I have arrived in search of love.
Really? You expect us to believe that you're in a cave in the complete dark, filled with Undead, searching for love?

mission.name: Lonely Existence
mission.desc: Galya laments her true nature. It seems she has not had any visitors that were capable of holding a conversation for quite a while.

line.text: It is difficult, being an Element of acid. No one to hold me... no one to care for me.
I thought the Mechas and Undead might be more open-minded, but I fear I was wrong. They melt in my arms, and not in the good way.

mission.name: Thermometer Search
mission.desc: Aria steers back the conversation to your original purpose for delving into the mine's depths. There is little you could do to aid Galya's quest for love.

line.text: Enough of this talk. Have you seen a thermometer?

mission.name: Item Collector
mission.desc: Galya points towards the back of the cavern, where a particularly large Undead glowers at you with red eyes. Other Undead have remained by its side, as if guarding this one creature...

line.text: Mm, yes, I may know what you're talking about. See that brute of an Undead over there?
Look closely at the items lodged in his back...

mission.name: Brute Boss
mission.desc: Aria grins as Galya points to the Undead. The necromancer steps toward the brute, the rest of the Undead cowering beneath her gaze.

line.text: That has to be it. Let's crush it and get out of here!

mission.name: Hero's Return
mission.desc: With the thermometer now in hand, you and Aria set out to return to Fireshard Mine's surface, in order to confront Warden Scyer. Galya gestures for you to come closer to her.

line.text: You're going back, aren't you? Let me show you... a shortcut...

mission.name: Path to the Surface
mission.desc: Galya shows you to a minecart. She points towards a faint light at the end of the tunnel, partially obscured by a few remnant Undead.

line.text: Follow the tracks and you will reach the surface.

mission.name: Undead Ward
mission.desc: The minecart clacks forward steadily, occasional Undead clawing as you pass. The light starts to get brighter, Undead becoming scarcer as you near the sunlight...

mission.name: Plan of Mecha Attack
mission.desc: You and Aria have returned to the exterior of the strip mine. Mechas have already spotted your arrival, clanking towards you with frightening red robotic eyes.

line.text: If we cause enough trouble, their boss will have no choice but to meet us.

mission.name: Raucous Rumble
mission.desc: You and Aria start to clear out the droves of the Mechas. In the distance you spot more reinforcements, Scyer leading them towards you.

mission.name: Dance Off
mission.desc: Scyer attacks with the same fury that he showed during your last scuffle. Aria has a plan; she slides close to you and whispers....

line.text: Like a fool you've come back, but can you handle this attack?!
Keep him distracted, adventurer, and I'll plug that thermometer straight into that melted sludge.

mission.name: Thermometer Returned
mission.desc: Aria claps the thermometer straight into Warden Scyer. He reels back, steam emitting from his shoulder pads. He collapses to the ground on his knees, using one hand to support himself.

line.text: Did it work?

mission.name: Mecha Loyalty
mission.desc: Loyal robots form a line to protect Scyer. They fight fiercely, waiting for their Warden to regain his strength.

mission.name: Just Like Last Time
mission.desc: Scyer shakes, his circuitry crackling uncertainly. He manages to rise back to his feet, fire flickering back to life inside him.

line.text: My power short circuited, what trickery is this? To turn me blind, and make me miss?
He still looks pretty angry. That mecha must have lied about the thermometer fixing him!

mission.name: Call for Help
mission.desc: Scyer stumbles around, no longer in a condition to fight. It seems that the thermometer has messed up his normal sensors, and he can no longer see or fight. He shouts loudly at seemingly nothing...

line.text: You leave me no choice. To revive the Mecha Giant, I lift my voice!

mission.name: The Giant Awakens
mission.desc: The earth trembles. The giant shell of a mecha that you saw previously now begins to stir. It is buried up to its torso in the ground, but its arms move, slowly pulling itself up...

mission.name: Fireshard's Protector
mission.desc: The giant mecha stomps towards you! The smaller Mechas flee, doing their best not to get trampled underfoot.

line.text: Look out adventurer, this one looks tough!

mission.name: Celestial Elementals
mission.desc: The Celestial Orbs attract small Elementals. These Elementals are what give the Orbs their powers. You notice that the more Breezy Spirits with you, the more powerfully the Orbs respond.

mission.name: Breezy Power
mission.desc: You have taken to collecting the Breezy Spirits. With them, you are able to power up the Celestial Orbs, which allow you to borrow their strength.

mission.name: Celestial Vaults Arrival
mission.desc: Groc has called you to the Celestial Vault, the home of the Elementals. Ol' Cedric has decided to accompany you as backup. As your airship descends, Groc awaits your arrival on the small island.

line.text: Ah, adventurer, and Cedric. Thank you for coming so quickly.
Anything for an old friend, Groc.

mission.name: Tour of the Elements
mission.desc: Groc gives you a tour of the celestial islands. Each one is dedicated to a faction of Wyld, Aether, or Chaos, with Elementals choosing their preferred habitat.

line.text: Even with The Void defeated, the world rebuilds itself slowly. I have called you here because I require advice for a certain... circumstance.

mission.name: Avians Outside Their Element
mission.desc: On the island, you see a group of Avians. They are huddled together, watching the roaming Elementals with distant longing. A brightly colored Avian approaches you and Groc. Cedric visibly recoils, but then calms himself and pretends nothing happened...

line.text: Welcome back, Groc. Are these the consultants you mentioned?
They are. The two of them are wise beyond years. Now, please continue your story.

mission.name: Avian Refugees
mission.desc: The Avian's clothes set her apart from the other Avians. She holds herself with a certain composure, speaking in a formal tone. The leader has come to ask the Elementals for a great favor...

line.text: I am Magistrate Agni, and we are refugees from Duskwillow. First, The Void destroyed Red Feather Village.
Then Scylla destroyed our second home in Duskwillow. If you would have us, we would like to make the Celestial Vault our new home.

mission.name: Reconvene
mission.desc: Groc asks the Avian Magistrate for a moment to converse privately. You and Cedric step away from the Avians. Magistrate Agni waits patiently for your decision...

mission.name: Former Fiend
mission.desc: Cedric brims with rage. Now out of earshot of the Avians, he reveals that he already knows the Avian Magistrate from elsewhere.

line.text: That Avian fiend! Long ago, her forces attacked Golden Crown, and kidnapped the Mayor's son. We must not trust her.
I had thought it suspicious that they are asking sanctuary now, when Duskwillow was attacked months ago. Cedric's account only deepens my worry.

mission.name: A Friend or Enemy in Need
mission.desc: Groc considers what he knows of the Redfeather Avians, and weighs the safety of the Elementals. The decision has no clear answer...

line.text: Yet what if she has changed, and the Avians are truly in need? We cannot simply punish all of them for the misdeeds of their leader.
And if they are up to something, then this is the best place to keep an eye on them. Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.

mission.name: Return to the Matter at Wing
mission.desc: Groc has made up his mind. The three of you break your huddle, returning to the waiting Magistrate Agni, who has not moved since you left her.

mission.name: Protection Plan
mission.desc: Groc explains the terms as politely as he can. Although he wants to aid the Avians, he also has a plan to protect the Elementals in case something goes wrong...

line.text: Magistrate Agni, we Elementals are happy to provide you and the Redfeather Avians sanctuary.
To aid your transition, Cedric and the adventurer will stay close to your side.

mission.name: Celestial Orb Assault
mission.desc: Magistrate Agni contemplates Groc's words. Despite his phrasing, it is clear that Cedric and you will be watching the Avians. Then when she starts to answer...

line.text: Do you find this acceptable?
I-
Lord Groc, it's terrible! The orbs which power each island... they are being attacked!

mission.name: Groc's Request
mission.desc: Groc orders the Elemental to return and assist the defending forces. He turns to ask you for help, once again.

mission.name: Protectors of the Orb
mission.desc: The normally stoic Elemental is extremely alarmed. You and Cedric leave the Avians, heading towards the orbs and the forces that are attacking.

line.text: If the orbs are destroyed, the Celestial Vault will fall!
We'll help you protect the orbs. Right, adventurer?

mission.name: Orb Assailants
mission.desc: You follow Groc's lead and run to the first orb that powers the island. Avians in strange garments have surrounded the orb, fighting off the last of the Elementals.

mission.name: Order of Crimsonwings
mission.desc: A hooded Avian appears to be their leader. A strange white flame burns in his wing, yet it does not harm him. The Elementals are falling beneath his might.

line.text: Wingless creatures have no right to flight, now be judged by the Order of Crimsonwings!

mission.name: Redfeathers and Crimsonwings
mission.desc: Before the Avian can touch the orb, you, Cedric, and Groc arrive. The Avians' attention shifts to you, brandishing their magic and weapons...

line.text: Avian attackers, how conveniently timed! Tell me, you wouldn't be affiliated with the Redfeather Avians, would you?
Red though we both may be, a feather's power is limited by its wing. Do not confuse royal blood with peons.

mission.name: Unknown Crimsonwing Power
mission.desc: The Avians' wings become enveloped in some kind of power, like that of a white flame. Their eyes seem to look into your soul, pinpointing you and your companions' weaknesses, before they strike for your heart.

mission.name: Crimsonwing Tactics
mission.desc: Groc manages to clear a path to the Falling Petal orb, relying on you and Cedric to keep the Avian forces busy. Their tactics have switched from orb acquisition to overwhelming you with their sheer numbers.

line.text: We are too far up in the atmosphere for even Avians to maintain altitude. If you destroy these orbs, we will all perish.

mission.name: The Petal Orb's Power
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avian leader places his wing upon the orb. Energy starts to travel from the Petal Orb and to the Avian. Groc roars ferociously, charging forward.

line.text: It is a price we are willing to risk, but the orbs' power must be ours. The strong will survive, and the weak will die. It matters not if they are our own.
You're insane.

mission.name: Remaining Defense Points
mission.desc: The Crimsonwing Avian is forced to remove his wing from the Orb. Your combined forces are proving to be too much for them. They start to retreat, but Groc is hesitant to pursue them, as it would leave the Petal Orb undefended.

line.text: You may have defeated us here, but we will find holes in your defenses. Retreat!
I will stay here and protect the Petal Orb. Please go, and save the Lava and Basin Orbs!

mission.name: Race to the Lava Orb
mission.desc: While the Crimsonwing Avians fly to the next island, you and Cedric are forced to take the bridge connecting the islands. You hurry as quickly as you can move, hoping the Elementals can defend against the Avians until you arrive...

mission.name: Crimsonwing Mantra
mission.desc: The bridge pounds beneath your feet. It sways unsteadily, but holds as you and Cedric run across. The Crimsonwing Avians have already begun their assault on the Lava Orb.

line.text: ...And let us find peace in the realm between the factions of Aether, Chaos, and Wyld. Unite in our power of wings, and soar unto the heavens.

mission.name: Avian Resistance
mission.desc: The Elementals fall beneath the Crimsonwing Avians' attack. Once again, you and Cedric bring the fight to the Crimsonwings, determined to repel their forces.

mission.name: Breathtaking Fighting
mission.desc: The Lava Orb glows with a unique light compared to the Petal Orb. You can sense the artifact granting you further powers, as if requesting that you aid in its defense.

line.text: Huff... We can continue this as long as you, huff, like. But we'll just catch up and beat you again.
So you claim, but your heavy breathing betrays your body's truth.

mission.name: Secret of the Celestial Vault
mission.desc: The fighting intensifies once again. Without Groc, your forces are noticeably weaker. But still you and Cedric carry on his request, aiming to protect the Lava Orb...

line.text: The Celestial Vault holds many secrets. Would you defend the Elementals if you knew the truth?
We will always stand by our friends in need.

mission.name: Empty Resources
mission.desc: Rayne has been tasked with settling the Redfeather Avians into their new home, the Celestial Vault. Unfortunately, resources are spread thin. Magistrate Agni approaches Rayne for a favor...

line.text: Ah, Rayne. Might I trouble you for a few more blankets? There are too few to go around the entire camp.
Magistrate Agni... I wish that I could, but unfortunately we have no more to spare.

mission.name: Refilled Resources
mission.desc: The next day, Rayne goes to check up on the Redfeather Avians. To Rayne's surprise, the Avians all have blankets! They all look to be made well, and are of high quality.

line.text: Thank you so much, Rayne. These blankets are a most generous gift.
Ah, but - I am not the one who provided them. Where did you get them?
Oh? A shipment arrived, so I had assumed it was from you. Regardless, we are very grateful.

mission.name: Gifts for All
