mission.desc: Scyer stays closer to you and Aria after the last attack. Monsters still roam the area, ones who were touched by The Void in the past, and other strange spirits.

line.text: We're not far from where Samael tried to free The Void. The Undead here never recovered from its effects.

mission.name: Reunion with a General
mission.desc: You spy a human in the distance, fighting against the Undead! You quickly rush to his aid, Scyer right along with you, Aria reluctantly following. When you get closer, you realize the human is a familiar face.

line.text: You're a sight for sore eyes, adventurer. Help me clear out these Undead!

mission.name: Soldiers on a Mission
mission.desc: Garrick finishes cleaving a large Undead in half, then turns his attention to you. Aria wastes no time in following their objective.

line.text: Garrick. Where is Tarian?
Blunt as always, Aria. Tarian is in the shack ahead, trying to find ancient technology.

mission.name: Caring Machine
mission.desc: Aria starts moving off towards the shack with a decisive purpose. However, Garrick remains in place, staring blankly ahead. Scyer waves a metallic hand in front of his face.

line.text: Why are you waitin' out here? Is there something you fear?

mission.name: Past Mistakes
mission.desc: Garrick doesn't answer immediately. He looks up at to the hill with the small shack. Charcoaled wood and dilapidated planks are visible, the place abandoned years ago.

line.text: I just got a lot of bad memories up there.
Lord Tarian has been inside for a long time. You should check up on him.

mission.name: Blockade
mission.desc: You catch up to Aria, who has stopped before the door. The wood creaks loudly as she shakes the handle, the door refusing to budge.

line.text: It's locked.

mission.name: Rickety Shack
mission.desc: The rest of the shack is barely held together. Scyer analyzes the surrounding openings, taking note of each hole. Even with the door locked, the shack is hardly secure.

line.text: Why let a door be a roadblock? All it needs is one good sock.

mission.name: Open Sesame
mission.desc: Aria beats Scyer to the punch. She slams her fist against the wood, punching a hole through the decaying material. She flips the lock open from the inside, before pulling it open easily.

line.text: Nice.
Okay it's open. Let's go, rhyme-bot.

mission.name: Ghostly Abode
mission.desc: The inside is eerily cold. Ghosts and wandering spirits roam restlessly about, unhappy with the unwelcome visitors. Your group carefully navigates through them, taking out any that get too close.

mission.name: Two Old Men Reunited
mission.desc: Malchior has dragged Tarian out of the small shack. The two friends catch up on what they've missed over the last few months, as Malchior has been traveling on the airship.

line.text: Malchior, why did you call me out here?
It's simple, my friend... I require your skills!

mission.name: World's Center Dangers
mission.desc: Malchior takes Tarian past the rocky path, into the snowy forest. They pass many diseased, rotted trees; monsters and undead lurking in their shadows.

line.text: There is an enemy that only you can fell...
Then this must be serious, if you're asking me over your adventurer friend.

mission.name: The Biggest Tree
mission.desc: Malchior stops at a large tree, one of the few that hasn't been tainted by the disease. It grows strong and tall, evergreen pine needles sticking out from its branches.

line.text: Right here! This gigantic pine tree!-

mission.name: Ax of the Lich Lord
mission.desc: Tarian stops cold. He has humored many of Malchior's outlandish requests in the past, but he cannot figure out his motivation behind this one.

line.text: Malchior, my ax is meant for cleaving bone, not chopping firewood!

mission.name: Holiday Presents
mission.desc: Malchior begs Tarian to reconsider his earlier choice. The tree is meant for others who have never seen such things, not for one of Malchior's experiments.

line.text: But think of the Chaos children back in Karthos, and how they'd decorate this big tree!
Fine, I'll do it, but don't you dare tell anyone about this. I have a reputation to uphold.

mission.name: Mechanical Undead
mission.desc: Remnant shards crack beneath Scyer's metal feet. He shuffles forward, arms held up like a zombie, the Undead behind him mimicking the same motions. Light has shifted in Scyer's electronic eyes, lacking their normal brightness.

mission.name: Remnant Energy
mission.desc: A powerful aura radiates from Scyer and the Undead. The Spellstone shards vibrate with pitched intensity at each Undead's step. The air itself thrums with the power.

mission.name: Team Support
mission.desc: Tarian evaluates the other Undead cooly. Once they pass a certain threshold, Tarian charges forward. His ax cleanly cuts through one of the zombies, but a horde remains behind them.

mission.name: Rescue Mission
mission.desc: You and Aria focus on saving Scyer. Aria slams dark blasts of energy against him. The strange, powerful aura has taken ahold of the Mecha, yet you and Aria are immune to its effect.

mission.name: Eerie Shack
mission.desc: Light filters in through the broken stained glass. A the center of the room is a pedestal, blue shards scattered on the floor. Remnant glass shards can also be seen at its base.

line.text: Annnd not a soul in sight. Breaking in was loud enough to wake the dead.

mission.name: Shattered Spellstone
mission.desc: Aria pokes around the glass, careful not to step on it as she takes a closer look at the emptied pedestal. A gigantic monster must have been contained within...

line.text: All these shards are from a shattered Spellstone. The creature inside must be long gone by now.

mission.name: Lich Lord
mission.desc: Aria jumps upon realizing another soul is at the edge of the room. Tarian stands silently near the stained glass, half hidden in a bookshelf's shadow, peering intently through it. Aria hesitates to approach him.

line.text: ...Tarian?

mission.name: Chaos Leader
mission.desc: Tarian snaps out of whatever reverie he was in. At the sound of Aria's voice, he turns to greet you and your group.

line.text: Ah, Aria. You've traveled a long way to find me. I've been researching methods to protect Karthos.

mission.name: Vulcanos's Plan
mission.desc: Aria wastes no time in explaining the meaning of your adventure. After Kensho's betrayal, it's important that the other Faction leaders be made aware of the Titans' movements.

line.text: Then I suppose our worry was for nothing. We wanted to warn you that Vulcanos may be up to something with the Chaos.

mission.name: Looming Threat
mission.desc: Tarian stares intently at Aria, as if he can see inside her soul. She squirms uncomfortably at his gaze, unused to the lich paying her special heed.

line.text: What is it, Tarian? You're giving me a funny look.

mission.name: Mecha Machination
mission.desc: However, Tarian's gaze is not directed at Aria. He stares right past her, to another figure lurking behind her...

line.text: Don't worry about me. Worry about that Mecha behind you.

mission.name: Silent Scyer
mission.desc: Steam emits from Scyer's arms and furnace. His robotic eyes stare unflinchingly forward, his mouth a grim line.

line.text: Scyer? You've never been quiet a day in your life. You're scaring me.

mission.name: Scyer's Meltdown
mission.desc: Scyer raises his arms, bringing them down upon Aria! She nimbly dodges from his crushing metal grasp. Stray Undead gather behind Scyer, the Mecha mindlessly shuffling forward like one of the Undead.

mission.name: Chaos Influence
mission.desc: Tarian shakes his head. Scyer seems to have completely lost his mind, trying desperately to attack you and Aria, along with the other monsters.

line.text: We are close to The Void's origin. Remnants of its power still affect those sensitive to it, causing them to attack allies.
Or perhaps this is Vulcanos's doing...

mission.name: Dismantling Protocol
mission.desc: Tarian helps you defend against the monsters. He brings his ax down against the Undead who refuse to obey him, clearing a path to the mad Mecha.

line.text: Dismantle him, if you must. He can't be allowed to continue.

mission.name: Machine Repairs
mission.desc: Disabling Scyer seems to be the only way to save your friend. Aria readies her own dark spells, the group fighting through the Undead to reach him.

line.text: I knew bringing him along was trouble. Once we get him out of here, he should go back to his normal idiotic self.

mission.name: Overgrown Welcome
mission.desc: You and your companions fly the airship to Elaria, so that you can warn the Elarian excavators about the danger from Atlas. However as your ship gets closer, you see that the entire area has been overgrown by plant life!

mission.name: Brave New World
mission.desc: Scraggly vines have strangled the old camp site. It looks like the place has been overrun with wildlife for years, but it was only a few months ago that you started your adventure here. You find a small clearing to land your airship.

line.text: Adventurer! General Ursurio! Good timing.
What happened here? Did someone spill fertilizer all over camp?

mission.name: Wyld Angels
mission.desc: You and Ursurio are immediately greeted by a familiar face after landing. The Ranger gives you a quick update on what has happened in Elaria in your absence.

line.text: These plants sprung from the ground and kept growing and growing.
Next thing we knew, me and the other excavators got attacked by angels!

mission.name: Attack From Above
mission.desc: As the Ranger tries to fill you in on more details, you spot winged invaders in the sky. They fly between the tall trees, but there can be no mistake: they're heading straight towards you!

line.text: Angels? Is Samael causing trouble again?
Nope. Look out, 'ere they come!

mission.name: Beasts and Men
mission.desc: You fight off the Angel army. Most are beasts with halos or have unique clothes and paintings on their faces. They look very different than the Angels from Skyhaven.

mission.name: Missing Excavators
mission.desc: With the Ranger's arrows and Ursurio's raw strength, you manage to push back the invading Angels. However, you recall seeing more people in Elaria than just the Ranger, who are no longer accounted for...

line.text: Phew... Close one. A bunch of 'em came earlier and kidnapped the other excavators!
Then we have to go save them. Come on, lead the way.

mission.name: Atlas's Danger
mission.desc: You explain your original purpose for coming to Elaria. This land is known to be home of Atlas, the Titan of Wyld. However, his influence has already touched Elaria.

line.text: Aye, well, don't look so down. I doubt there's much you could have done initially against this magical undergrowth.

mission.name: Wyld Invitation
mission.desc: Another wave of Angels arrives from the sky! As you prepare for another attack, a vaguely familiar Angel steps forward to talk to you. Although her appearance has changed, you recall her working with Samael.

line.text: Hold! Lord Atlas wishes to speak to you. Will you accept his invitation?
And how do we know this talk will be peaceful? You took away the Elarian researchers!

mission.name: Released Captives
mission.desc: The Angel's allegiance has changed to the Wyld. However, she gives a promise of aid if you and the others will negotiate...

line.text: As a sign of goodwill, Lord Atlas will release your captured friends.

mission.name: Forward to Negotiation
mission.desc: With the promise of potential peace, your allies are more willing to listen to the Angel. She leads you further into the trees, through a winding green path.

line.text: If he just wants to talk, we should be okay. Now, take us to your leader!
Hehe, I've always wanted to say that.

mission.name: Dangers of the Wyld
mission.desc: Stray monsters and other fiends continue to prowl the area. The Angel allows you to defend yourself, but offers no help in keeping the monsters at bay.

mission.name: The Bark Throne
mission.desc: Eventually you come to an area surrounded by the trees, their canopies obstructing your view of the sky. A giant sits on a throne made of vines and trees; Atlas has grown bigger, and stronger, than you last saw him...

line.text: Here we are.

mission.name: Recent History
mission.desc: The continent has been threatened by those who would conquer everything, time and time again. But such tales also give rise to heroes who stand against the tyranny. The goblins, in their zeal to expand, united the other tribes as their enemies.

mission.name: Tyrant's Reach
mission.desc: The feared, bloodthirsty leader Reks self-proclaimed himself the Goblin King. His crusade banished the Avians and Frogs from their homes, threatening the Angels and Dragons next. But a Skyhaven spy infiltrated his ranks...

mission.name: Heroes of the People
mission.desc: Whispered tales unite Freya, the Skyhaven Agent with Fiona, the dragontamer. The two combined their skills to lead Goblin King Reks into a trap, which inevitably lead to his demise. They were both celebrated for their cunning and strength, but now...

mission.name: Defender of Atlas
mission.desc: A mighty hero stands in your way. That same key leader who defeated Reks has now turned against you and your friends. Freya and the angels that have sworn allegiance to Atlas fight with all their might, while the Wyld titan watches from above.

mission.name: Earth
mission.desc: Atlas's voice resonates in the trees and grass, the wildlife speaking into your mind. When you last faced him, he was but a shell of his former self. He has changed completely.

line.text: Fire. Wind. Earth. When thou first arrived in this continent, it was in this place: Elaria.
That was no coincidence.

mission.name: Eternal Devotion
mission.desc: Atlas outlines his plan. Unlike Solaron or Vulcanos, who are mainly concerned with fighting each other, Atlas has a very specific plan for the Wyld.

line.text: We will defend ourselves here in the forest. We will weather the storm between Chaos and Aether until they destroy themselves.

mission.name: Wyld's Sway
mission.desc: You have greater plans than hiding away in the forest. However, a strange gleam has entered your friends' eyes. Ursurio and the Ranger speak almost simultaneously about their agreement...

line.text: Ya know, that makes more sense than I expected.
Mm. Good. Yes, we should stay here and help the Wyld.

mission.name: Immunity
mission.desc: Atlas ponders how you alone are able to resist his influence. Light tremors rock the earth, the Angels and your friends' attention turning straight to you.

line.text: Thou art immune to my dominion? How?
I see your soul... black, and empty; corrupted. Now perish.

mission.name: Impunity
mission.desc: The Wyld Angels, and your friends attack you! The strange light persists in Ursurio's and the Ranger's eyes. Something has turned them against you.

mission.name: Atlas's Influence
mission.desc: You struggle to defend yourself against the Angels and your friends. You fear that going all-out would damage your friends, who are clearly not in their right minds...

mission.name: Lurking Ally
mission.desc: The battle continues. An Angel has snuck up behind you! You turn around, ready to defend, surprised to see that this other is raising his sword against the other Angels. A familiar face has come to your aid...

line.text: I was going to stay out of the way and let you handle Atlas, but it looks like you could use some help.
Another soul unclaimed, yet my power cannot reach. Ugly, corrupt souls... destroy them, my children!

mission.name: Samael and Dyrnwyn's Return
mission.desc: Samael and his familiar sword Dyrnwyn have come to help you. They fight against the Wyld Angels, as Samael assesses the largest threats. Atlas watches the fight from afar, allowing his minions to do his work.

line.text: Atlas is a spirit. Even if we defeat him, he would just return again.

mission.name: Familiar Plan
mission.desc: Samael and you work together. He explains a plan that could be used to save Ursurio and the Ranger. It sounds not unlike how you rescued Scyer...

line.text: I will take on your friends. If we get them away from Atlas, they should regain their minds.

mission.name: Friendship Revoked
mission.desc: The Wyld Angel who took you to Atlas is targetting Samael. She pushes aside the other Angels to reach him, standing threateningly before you.

line.text: It will be up to you to hold off Atlas and Freya, and the rest of their drones.

mission.name: Freya's Threat
mission.desc: Samael is trying to reach your friends, but the Wyld Angel Freya is stopping him from even reaching them. She sends the Angels in to attack you, slowing down your progress.

line.text: I'm not being controlled, Samael. And now you will pay the price for looking down on me!

mission.name: Angel Showdown
mission.desc: The Angels gather around you and Samael, blocking off your path to your friends. In order to make your plan work, you're going to have to help Samael first.

line.text: Lord Atlas, please allow me to fight. It will be my honor to crush them!

mission.name: Titan Countermeasures
mission.desc: You have returned to Dawnglow Swamp at Cedric's recommendation. The threat of the three titans - Solaron, Atlas, and Vulcanos - still looms large. Cedric thinks he knows of a countermeasure to stop their growing power.

line.text: Curious that Ursurio and The Ranger fell prey to Atlas's influence, yet you and Samael did not.
The same could be said about Scyer. If Scyer was influenced by Vulcanos, then you, Aria, and Tarian were immune.

mission.name: Previous War
mission.desc: The previously infected Dawnglow has now been cleansed from The Void's taint. Moss grows green and mushrooms are a bright orange, now free from the decay.

line.text: This isn't the first time that the Titans meddled with our world.
Long ago, the Dawnglow frogs tried to resist their power by reviving a mechanical titan of their own.

mission.name: Revitalized Dawnglow
mission.desc: Although The Void's grip on the wildlife has faded, it has only spurred its natural monsters to grow even more ferocious. You fend off the feral Insects and other creatures.

mission.name: Hidden Secrets
mission.desc: You and Cedric are trying to keep a low profile to avoid the Dawnglow Emperor. He has never liked you much, and you're certain a fight would be inevitable if you met. Instead, you set about finding ancient relics...

line.text: There are mechanisms, hidden in parts of the swamp. If we release them, we should find the Mecha Titan.

mission.name: Prior Inhabitants
mission.desc: Originally from Dawnglow, Cedric knows the swampland very well. Hidden in the moss, through the tangled vines, are steel contraptions and ruins of an ancient civilization.

line.text: I have always wondered who came before us. And why would they abandon everything they built?

mission.name: Final Binding
mission.desc: The ancient remains hint of a long lost civilization, now buried beneath the swamp. Remnants steel and silver can still be found in the murky waters. Cedric brushes away the dirt and grime from a large, mechanical button.

line.text: Are you ready? I'm going to release the last binding for the Mecha Titan.

mission.name: Secrets Plundered
mission.desc: The button compresses smoothly. Too smoothly. You don't hear a click or indication that anything has activated. Cedric frowns, pushing it down a few more times.

line.text: That's odd, it's either defective or someone already opened it.

mission.name: Titan's Footsteps
mission.desc: You hear the pounding of something in the distance. The ground tremors beneath each impact. The sound grows closer, the vibration even stronger. You and Cedric look up past the trees and vines...

mission.name: The Mecha Titan
mission.desc: Far above the treetops, you see a mechanical giant! His once golden tincture has been smeared with mud and a crown of plants.

line.text: Ah, small Spellstone master. You have returned to my home.

mission.name: Viracocha Returns
mission.desc: You have fought the mighty Viracocha before. Although his power differed from a normal titan, he was a powerful foe himself. He kneels down to get a better view of you and Cedric.

line.text: Ah! Um... hm. It appears you two already know each other.
Indeed. I am Viracocha. One day, I will be powerful enough to become a titan.

mission.name: Warring Factions
mission.desc: Cedric hobbles closer to Viracocha, beseeching his aid. The mechanical giant, although large in form, has always tried to remain an impartial judge when listening to the problems of mortals.

line.text: We might need that day to come sooner rather than later.
Without the power of The Void to keep them in check, the titans have returned to their former warmongering ways.

mission.name: Cedric's Plea
mission.desc: Cedric has already seen multiple wars in his lifetime. First, the Emperor of Dawnglow waged war on his neighbors. Then, the war against The Void created battles even against friends. He would do anything to prevent a repeat of that fate.

line.text: Their presence alone is enough to even turn the steadfast against us.
Please help us, Viracocha. We need to stop their influence, or we'll all be consumed by their war.

mission.name: BGE wants to fight?!
mission.desc: Just when you were enjoying a well deserved rest from the expedition grinding, a new weirdo appears to challenge you into a Spellstone game!

line.text: I'm finally here! Nothing can contain my untested power!
Oh no! Some evil developer (probably a new guy) merged too many BGEs into one!
Well... I'm sure the players can handle this.
Bye!
I'll merge every tribe into a new, balanced tribe! Muahahaha!
... Unless you stop me, of course.

mission.name: Mission: Impossible
mission.desc: The BGE Conflux wrote this: Don't play this mission! It is impossible to beat! Just retreat and play a normal node. Don't you need to beat Atlas or something?

line.text: I recognize you're powerful, player. And good looking. But you won't stop my minions!
I gathered the most powerful enemies an April's Fools monster can afford (and turns out that's not much). Anyway... Behold...
THE CRAB!
*Snip snip*
This crab's deck has many, many common cards. But they are enhanced with the Common Revenge BGE! Muahahahaha!
*Snip snip snip*
Hmmm... I see. It says the Devs didn't add Common Revenge to my powers.
Well... sucks to be you, little buddy.
*very afraid snip*

mission.name: The Cannon
mission.desc: Not all BGE Conflux's allies are crabs. Some are actually powerful enemies with stacked decks full of unfair cards. BGE Conflux hopes the next enemy is actually one of those.

line.text: You beat the crab (no surprise there)... But you won't defeat your next enemy!
Piercing Cannon, I choose you!
Hey Mr. BGE! What's up?
Piercing Cannon, it's your turn! Finish this foolish player so I can achieve my dream of merging all tribes!
Ok, boss.
Hey, player! I guess... prepare to fight or something?

mission.name: The Cress
mission.desc: As this is the fourth mission, I thought it will be good for the players to be reminded of what your current situation is: the BGE Conflux was let free and it's trying to merge all tribes into one, for some reason. Defeat it and you will become Emperor of Spellstone!

line.text: Don't get so full of yourself! You just defeated one of my... my... let me check..
one, two three.
One of my THREE ALLIES!
Cress! It's your turn! Destroy this fool!
Hey, just a small suggestion. Why don't we just... attack the player all at once?
Because, Just Cress, multiplayer is not allowed in Spellstone.
I see. Well... at least I have an overpowered deck, right?
I assure you. Your's is certainly more powerful than the crab's.
That's not reassuring at all!
Fine! Let's get this over with!

mission.name: The Frog
mission.desc: It seems I skimmed over the description of this event and there is no such thing as an Emperor of Spellstone. Maybe I dreamt about it? Too bad! It sounded awesome! Well... just defeat the bad guys and claim your rewards! For... reasons!

line.text: You defeated Just Cress?! Now I really wish there was a multiplayer Spellstone mode...
Not gonna happen.
So, player! You defeated almost all my minions, but as a boss just a couple days old... I'm sure that's no indication that you will defeat the next one.
Hi! I'm your next opponent.
People think I'm the worst. But actually, I'm a really nice frog!
So, have fun and good luck! *wink wink*
Less talking and more spellstoning!

mission.name: A BGE for All
mission.desc: This is it! The final battle against the evil BGE Conflux that threatens to balance Spellstone! How dares it?!

line.text: I see you obliterated the frog. And the cannon. And everyone else. Did you know you were this strong? Anyway...
I'm done. It was fun, though! Byeee!
*tries to run away but you catch it*
Nooo! Please! Dont hurt me!
Crab! Help me! Attack the player!
*snip snip*
Fine! I'll fight!
... Stupid crab...
As I know how this goes, I'll use this last chance to say something interesting.
To give this event a conclusion of some sort, if you will.
I was wrong to try to merge all the tribes into one. I suck. But I sincerely hope this was fun for you...
Wait. That can't be right. Who wrote this dialogue?
No! Wait! I'm not ready! Don't attack me!

mission.name: Revenge of the Storm
mission.desc: The commons are rising up! Their power is overwhelming! Stop them before they destroy the world! Or join them. I'm a mission description, not a cop.

line.text: *Whoosh* We come! *Whoosh* Revenge of the Commons! *Woosh*

mission.name: Revenge of the Dead, Part XXIV
mission.desc: I feel like we've been here before...

line.text: NYAAAA! We come for your bones! You know, to like... replace the ones you broke...
HAND EM' OVER!!!

mission.name: Revenge of the Snip Snip
mission.desc: I don't know what they are saying, but these crabs seem really upset.

line.text: *Snip*

mission.name: Revenge of the Woods
mission.desc: The common cards of the woods have gathered to defeat you!

line.text: We come, the denizens of the forest, to take our vengeance...
WOOF! :D

mission.name: Revenge of the Souls
mission.desc: The soul wisps have gathered, looking for vengeance for all their brothers who you've put into lanterns, and torches, or whatever ya'll do with little light spirits.

line.text: WooooOOOooooOOOOO... jerk!

mission.name: Revenge of the Revengest!
mission.desc: Some weirdo with a bunch of bombs has showed up. They seem like they know you but you can't place their face.

line.text: I HAVE RETURNED, PREPARE FOR OUR FATEFUL DUEL!

mission.name: Common Crusher Crew
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the Common menace?!

line.text: Never fear! The Legend League has arrived!
Let's put these Commons back in their place!

mission.name: Common Squashing Squad
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: YEEEEEEE HAWWWWWWW!

mission.name: Common Terror Team
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: I don't feel so good. Can I go home? I miss Cindertooth.

mission.name: Common Conquering Club
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

mission.name: Common Bashing Bunch
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: What do we have here? This looks fun!

mission.name: Common Trashing Troupe
mission.desc: The Legendary cards have arrived to put things back in their rightful place! Can they defeat the common menace?!

line.text: Hello there.

mission.name: Living Relic
mission.desc: A giant was built to house a mighty soul, instilled with a dream to fulfill an impossible purpose. Once golden, now tarnished through the passing ages, Viracocha is a living relic of a time now forgotten.

mission.name: Emperor's Rage
mission.desc: Viracocha lumber towards you with painful slowness. Trees snap beneath his feet. Marshwater splashes and makes a sucking noise he pulls through the mud. Behind him, the Frog Emperor shrieks shrilly.

mission.name: Dawnglow Protectors
mission.desc: Frogs riding Dragons and feral Insects run past Viracocha, cutting off your escape. They yell battle cries, swarming you and slowing down your escape from Dawnglow Swamp.

mission.name: Swamp Escape
mission.desc: You and Cedric cut down those who stand in your way. The older Frog is having difficulty in moving fast, huffing loudly as he runs. Viracocha's thunderous footsteps follow you slowly, as you escape from the Emperor's forces.

mission.name: Strength of Mind
mission.desc: The mechanical giant is able to answer even without thinking. He explains how the Titans are able to twist even the minds of your friends. The method is eerily similar to that of The Void.

line.text: Mortals are fractured creatures, possessing splinters of the Titans' spirits.
Only those whose spirits are touched with the negating Void can resist the Titans' dominion.

mission.name: The Void's Protection
mission.desc: Viracocha is able to provide even more insight into how the Titans revived their powers. You are reminded eerily of Vel's words, and how she believed you could overcome the challenge of defeating The Void...

line.text: With The Void gone, so too did the mortals' protector leave them.
So, in a rather obtrusive way, The Void was actually protecting us...?

mission.name: Containing the Titans
mission.desc: With the Titans' rise in power now known, all the remains is a way of defeating them. Although Viracocha was created to combat the Titans, he could not be considered even one of their equals.

line.text: The Titans just need a container to restrain them.
I was created to be one, but I lack the necessary power to transcend to the spirit realm.

mission.name: Ascending Titan
mission.desc: Cedric considers the gravity of Viracocha's words. The titans have been mythical creatures for a long time. One doesn't simply become their equal by willpower alone.

line.text: Is it possible? For a construct to become part spirit?

mission.name: The Power Coils
mission.desc: Viracocha knows that the way forward is difficult. His dream is more than just something he came up with himself. It was the reason why he was created.

line.text: Yes... you will need to activate the Power Coils across the continent. Take this map.

mission.name: Emperor's Intrusion
mission.desc: Webbed claws squish through the swamp. A familiar Emperor, escorted by a legion of Dawnglow frogs, stomps into the clearing where you've been talking with Viracocha.

mission.name: Hopping Mad
mission.desc: The Frog Emperor is hopping mad, both figuratively and literally. He jumps over and over again, like a child throwing a tantrum. Despite his demands, Viracocha has yet to follow them.

line.text: Viracocha! Intruders! Take care of them!

mission.name: Cedric's Old Ally
mission.desc: Cedric pushes you behind him. A former member of the Dawnglow Frogs, he knows many of them quite well. Some of the frogs bow down in respect as the old frog approaches.

line.text: Ah, I've been gone so long, that I'm unknown to you now, Emperor?

mission.name: Emperor's Hesitation
mission.desc: Uncomfortable silence hangs in the air, Cedric's greeting remaining unanswered. The frogs look hesitant to attack with the former First Sword standing before them. The Emperor's eyes water.

line.text: Cedric...

mission.name: Forgiveness Not Granted
mission.desc: The Frog Emperor's wails spur the frogs back into actions. Their spears and bows are pointed at both of you again, and it would seem that Cedric's influence can't let you out completely free.

line.text: Cedric! You left me for some old Golden Leaf hag?! What was wrong with Dawnglow?

mission.name: Captive Ally
mission.desc: Cedric backs away from the fuming Frog Emperor. The Dawnglow Frogs have resumed their attacks with renewed vigor. The Emperor shrilly shrieks his commands to any that obey him.

line.text: You're coming back, even if I have to drag you back!
Viracocha, get them!

mission.name: False Chase
mission.desc: The ground shakes as Viracocha takes a step forward. Frogs run between his gigantic legs as they prepare to obstruct your way. You grab Cedric and begin pushing past their ranks; it's time to get out of the swamp!

line.text: Refusing would only injure his pride further, and increase his incessant cries.
I will make a showing of chase, but you must escape and activate the Power Coils!

mission.name: Past Escape
mission.desc: You have finished narrowly escaping from the Dawnglow frogs, although some of the more adventerous ones even chased your airship. Even when you land in Luminis, you have to fight off a patrol of Frogs.

mission.name: Yuriel's Welcome
mission.desc: Smoke rises from Luminis's castle. Stray fires light the plains. Everything is drenched in a strange magical light. A familiar face runs to meet you.

line.text: Ah, adventurer. To what do we owe this unexpected pleasure?

mission.name: Luminis Disorder
mission.desc: Elyse leaves the airship with you. She looks at the smoking castle in the distance, then to the owl. Luminis has changed since the last time you three met here.

line.text: Err... everything okay here in Luminis? It looks like your castle is... on fire...

mission.name: Aether Civil War
mission.desc: Luminis is at war with itself. Avians are fighting other Avians. Even one of the frog patrols sent to chase you is caught in a skirmish.

line.text: Without Lord Samael, Luminis's inhabitants have fallen into disorder.
They are torn between following their old ways, or the new Aether leader, Kensho.

mission.name: Power Coil Search
mission.desc: The map Viracocha gave you has a Power Coil listed in Luminis. Although he told you what to look for, he failed to mention what exactly a Power Coil looks like.

line.text: We came here looking for something called a Power Coil. But there must be something we can do to help here.

mission.name: Ancient Knowledge
mission.desc: Yuriel has vast knowledge of ancient machines and devices, having spent a good deal of time in Skyhaven's Archives. If anyone can point you on the right path to find the Power Coils, it's him.

line.text: Hoo, don't worry, most people have left Luminis already.
Perhaps what you're looking for is that tower generating magical electricity?

mission.name: Aether Avians
mission.desc: Luminis residents are fighting each other. A group of Avians notices you on the path, and bar your way.

line.text: Stop, in the name of Lord Kensho!

mission.name: Fighting Further
mission.desc: You continue down the path towards the tower of electricity. Yuriel and Elyse help you fend off the unhappy Luminis residents.

mission.name: Chaotic Aether
mission.desc: Chaos has enveloped the once peaceful land of Luminis. Remnants of older battles are clearly visible, with scorch marks on brick road and charred grass.

line.text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but I miss when Samael lead the Aether!

mission.name: Samael's Leadership
mission.desc: Yuriel reminisces over the old days. Luminis was once considered a central hub on the continent, before becoming too exclusive, to eventually crumbling in power.

line.text: Hoo, he may have had a poor reputation among the other tribes, but he was a fair leader to us Aether.

mission.name: Wisp Roadblock
mission.desc: You remember going down this path a long time ago with Ursurio and Elyse. The wisps remember too, and refuse to let you pass without a rematch.

mission.name: Electric Tower
mission.desc: The three of you approach the tower. It rises to the sky, crackling with electricity. A strange aparatus is at its base, beaming with magic.

line.text: There it is! If that isn't a Power Coil, I don't know what is.

mission.name: Order
mission.desc: Through the vortex of Chaos that created life, to mantain that life some structure was needed. So Aether was formed, to rule and govern fairly, and bring order for sustainability.

mission.name: Bless
mission.desc: Clouds were formed to obscure the harsh gaze of the sun, and to nourish and protect that below it. Water, in turn, gave life to more creatures, and that is the essence of Aether.

mission.name: Sustain
mission.desc: While the heart may compell those to act rashly, the mind governs reason and lays forth the foundation of civilization. The flow of time and creation cannot be so easily reversed, continuing ever onward.

mission.name: Aether Realized
mission.desc: That is Aether. That is the manifestation that you have created. And this memory, this data, will be sent to the Titan Aspirer, Viracocha.

mission.name: Power Coil Elemental
mission.desc: When you get near, the aparatus makes a strange whirring noise. The base opens, an image of a wind Elemental blinking into existence in front of you.

mission.name: Elemental Summoning
mission.desc: More Elementals materialize around the tower, springing from the grass and nearby river. As your group prepares to fight, the wind Elemental speaks...

line.text: Commencing initialization welcome sequence. Greetings, sentients.

mission.name: Secrets Uncovered
mission.desc: Yuriel gets extremely excited. Studying ancient ruins and books of lost technology, Yuriel dreams of finding these kind of encounters.

line.text: Hoo, what?! It's never done this when I visited!
Um, what do we do? What - or who - are you?

mission.name: Mecha Elemental
mission.desc: The wind Elemental continues to speak. It is more than just an Elemental. Its pattern of speech is mechanical and hollow.

line.text: I am an AI designed to simulate Aether. I was offline until the Master initiated the boot sequence.

mission.name: Restoring Power
mission.desc: With the strange wind Elemental and Yuriel's information on its activation, it seems like you've found the Power Coil. You must complete the task here of activating it, to unlock more power for the mechanical Titan.

line.text: To fully reboot, you must help me attune to Aether.
Provide the necessary answers to automate Aether attunement process.

mission.name: Aether Test
mission.desc: The manufactured Elemental desires to test you. Elyse is eager to give the answers it desires, even if Aether isn't her specialty.

line.text: Question: What two elements embody Aether?
Oh, I know this! It's wind and water.
*Whirs*

mission.name: Tricky Question
mission.desc: As part of the test, some of the Elementals have begun fighting you. The wind Elemental continues to grill you on your Aether knowledge.

line.text: Question: When it comes to making judgement, which is the most important? Mind, heart, or soul.
Um...

mission.name: Yuriel's Knowledge
mission.desc: Thankfully, you have an Aether expert with you. With Elyse stumped on the next question, Yuriel takes over in teaching the machination the basics of Aether.

line.text: Hoo, allow me to help. The answer is Mind.
*Whirs*

mission.name: Yuriel's Expertise
mission.desc: After a small bump from earlier, the rest of the questions seem to be going smoothly. However, without the wind Elemental giving any feedback, there's no way to tell if the answers are correct.

line.text: Question: Which of these govern life: destruction, creation, or order.
Order.
*Whirs*

mission.name: Questions Complete
mission.desc: You are relying on your friends' knowledge of Aether to pass this test and activate the Power Coil. Meanwhile you fend off the army of Elementals and disgruntled Luminis residents.

line.text: Attunement complete.

mission.name: Aether Manifestation
mission.desc: The whirring noise that the wind Elemental was making finally stops. You hear scraping metal coming from inside the tower.

line.text: Fight the manifestation you created and I will send its memory bank to the Master.

mission.name: Incoming Threat
mission.desc: Heavy footsteps come from inside the tower. The door scrapes open to reveal a terrible monster!

line.text: Something's coming! Look out!

mission.name: Robot on a Mission
mission.desc: You return to Karthos, a designated spot on your map for one of the power coils. Fascinated by the land of lava, Scyer insists on accompanying you.

line.text: Land of fire, more like land of Scyer!
I ain't never been here before. We got time to explore?

mission.name: Land of Scyer
mission.desc: Scyer is very excited to find a place where more Chaos live than just the mechas in Fireshard Mine. You take a more scenic route than the one to the castle, mainly to find the power coil.

mission.name: Chaos Coil
mission.desc: However, the Chaos creatures seem more on edge than normal. You see them moving supplies back and forth, and more forts and checkpoints have been set up than your initial visit.

line.text: Is that the power coil in the distance? Time to confirm its existence!

mission.name: Red Roadblock
mission.desc: You hurry on to the strange structure, much like the one you found in Luminis, but this one with a red glow. Near it, you find a familiar red head...

line.text: Aw man, it's you guys. Come to shut off my super fun machine? Finders keepers!

mission.name: The Fun Machine
mission.desc: Decim has been poking around the machine, and doesn't want you to turn it off. Luckily that's not the reason why you're here, so Decim reluctantly lets you closer to the power coil.

line.text: Sit tight, and we'll activate the machine. It won't be like nothin' you ever seen!

mission.name: Mechanical Chaos
mission.desc: A creature appears from the machine. It has a very mechanical-sounding voice, identical to the one you encountered in Luminis.

line.text: Commencing initialization welcome sequence. Greetings, sentients.

mission.name: Decim's Fascination
mission.desc: Decim is extremely entertained by the changing structure and the appearance of the new creature. He lets you and Scyer continue to work his magic.

line.text: Whoa, what?! You weren't kidding! This is amazing!

mission.name: Revitalizing the Power Coil
mission.desc: The power coil guardian needs help, just like the Luminis one. As a mechanical creation, it lacks the knowledge of the Chaos.

line.text: I am an AI designed to simulate Chaos.
Provide the necessary answers to automate Chaos attunement process.

mission.name: Chaos Experts
mission.desc: Luckily, you have two Chaos experts with you. The free roaming spirit Mecha Scyer, and the freedom lover Decim. Although they have their differences, their answers are surprisingly in sync with each other.

line.text: What element embodies Chaos?
Everyone knows what the Chaos admire, and that's great balls of fire!

mission.name: Chaos Value
mission.desc: Decim can't help but help you. The answers are too easy for him. Between him and Scyer, the Chaos attunement is proceeding smoothly.

line.text: What is the most important of these three: freedom, spiritual strength, or power?
Freedom, duh!

mission.name: Attunement
mission.desc: Monsters from the surrounding Karthos area frequently interrupt you. On top of that, after every question the power coil sends its own creations to test your will.

mission.name: Manifestation Completion
mission.desc: The final question has been answered. All that remains is to fight the creation you helped bring into fruition, so that its memory can be sent back to Viracocha!

line.text: Attunement complete.
Fight the manifestation you created and I will send its memory bank to the Master.

mission.name: Disorder
mission.desc: In the beginning, there was nothing but The Void, an endless abyss stretching across the world. A spark flickered in the darkness; the first life. Chaos was born.

mission.name: Creation
mission.desc: The darkness parted for this spark. What started as a small flame quickly grew, encompassing the abyss until it ceased to be. Every living creature has a part of Chaos within them.

mission.name: Growth
mission.desc: There were no rules, just the glory of life. There was no deeper meaning, just the freedom to exist. That was what made the Chaos beautiful; the simplicity and dedication, to thrive and grow without knowing bounds.

mission.name: Chaos Realized
mission.desc: That is Chaos. That is the manifestation that you have created. And this memory, this data, will be sent to the Titan Aspirer, Viracocha.

mission.name: Karthos Critters
mission.desc: Even after defeating the power coil's Chaos manifestation, an unusual amount of Chaos have congregated on the path leading out. They seem to be waiting for something...

line.text: Is it just me, or are there more critters waiting to fight us three?

mission.name: Poor History
mission.desc: Decim hates any kind of structure and organization, including those of Karthos. He and Tarian have never gotten along, but recent events have made them even more tense.

line.text: Tarian's gone absolutely nuts, getting everyone ready for war!

mission.name: Former Friend
mission.desc: Another familiar face comes to greet you. Unfortunately, this seems to be more than just a social call...

line.text: Absolutely nuts, huh? Is that how you show your allegiance to your fellow Chaos?

mission.name: Insanity's Source
mission.desc: Scyer has been out of sorts ever since your mission at The Void's Center. He confronts General Garrick with his theory on what happened there.

line.text: I figured it out, why my wires got crossed. You're workin' for Vulcanos, and your soul was your cost!

mission.name: Call of Chaos
mission.desc: General Garrick reveals the truth! Although you saved him from The Void, he was never able to return to his normal self. Perhaps he never knew what it was...

line.text: HA! I could've said no, but The Void stole my fire.
Vulcanos returned it, and now there's nothing holding me back!

mission.name: Fighting Friend
mission.desc: Your old friend has embraced his wild side. All that's left is to fight and get past him!

line.text: What a sad man. Let's put him in the can!

mission.name: Chaos Leader
mission.desc: A familiar skeleton pushes past the mob of enemies that has swarmed you. He rushes over to General Garrick's side, glaring at you harshly.

line.text: What's going on here?

mission.name: Visit's Reason
mission.desc: General Garrick has been injured after initially attacking you. You let Tarian step between you two, trying not to initiate another fight.

line.text: Sir, that giant energy spike we detected came from here.

mission.name: Tarian's Wrath
mission.desc: Tarian is upset that you've come to Karthos unannounced and without his knowledge. He eyes the power coil behind you.

line.text: You trespass without my permission, take over our land's secrets, and attack my general?

mission.name: Questionable Motives
mission.desc: Scyer is unwilling to take Tarian's judgement, especially after he abandoned you to Vulcanos's influence at The Void's Center. By withholding his allegiance, he placed you in great danger.

line.text: You want a secret, try this... You been workin' against us; leadin' us amiss!

mission.name: Appeal to Skeleton's Humanity
mission.desc: Even in anger, Scyer knows that Tarian has been a valuable ally in the past. He beseeches the Chaos Lord to rethink his plans, wondering what Vulcanos could possibly offer that would be worth it.

line.text: Why you think teamin' with Vulcanos is the way? In the end he'll throw you away!

mission.name: Tarian's Forgiveness
mission.desc: For the sake of your friendship, Tarian gives you one favor. However, his mind is not swayed from his current course of action.

line.text: I didn't expect you to understand. We need Vulcanos's strength to keep out the Aether.
Now get out of here, before I change my mind!

mission.name: Know Your Enemy
mission.desc: Oda has asked you to accompany him to Tarragon Peak, where he thinks there might be clues to where and how Kensho became Solaron's pawn.

line.text: Thank you for coming with me, Adventurer. The last time we were here, we found signs of my First Order.
We may yet learn more about Kensho's transformation, and perhaps a strategy against Solaron.

mission.name: First Order Defenses
mission.desc: However, Tarragon Peak is alight with a different glow. Magical ley lines radiate the volcano, the place alight with a magical glow.

line.text: Someone's activated the First Order defenses. We should be careful - Kensho could be here.

mission.name: A Goblin and His Mecha
mission.desc: The volcano's base is oddly devoid of its normal dragon inhabitants. Instead, you see a group of goblins with their favorite weapons of choice, mechanical creations.

mission.name: Tribal Differences
mission.desc: Unfortunately, you spy a familiar goblin amongst them, with his magical rune sword. Daknak swaggers up to you, with a small group of goblins and a greater group of mechas.

line.text: Oy, it's the blokes that support that weakling, Boldur!
Daknak prove to you... Daknak strong! Daknak much, MUCH stronger than puny Boldur!

mission.name: Daknak's Plan
mission.desc: After the split between Boldur and Daknak, most goblins have chosen Boldur as their true leader. Just a small group of goblins support Daknak - and the difference in strength is showing.

line.text: Keep 'em busy, Daknak have better plan!

mission.name: Goblin Flight
mission.desc: Daknak flees from the strength of you and Oda, leaving a few of the mechanical beasts to keep you busy. Oda is displeased by this distraction.

line.text: I was expecting angry dragons, not Daknak and his minions. Hopefully that's the last of them.

mission.name: Up the Peak
mission.desc: Finally you continue your journey through Tarragon Peak. Although there's still some lingering problems, Daknak and his goblins are mainly leaving you alone.

mission.name: Within the Cave
mission.desc: You arrive at the same cave you visited previously. It's alight with the runes, the magical energy most intense in this spot.

line.text: Here we are. These are the markings I noticed our first time through.

mission.name: Dead End Lead
mission.desc: Try as he might, Oda still can't find anything new about his Order. Even a more thorough look at the ancient writings has revealed nothing new.

line.text: The First Order... what were you up to so long ago? Ugh, there's nothing new in these depictions. We'll have to look for other clues.

mission.name: Tarragon Dangers
mission.desc: You search farther up the volcano path. Daknak's remaining loyal goblins, with their mecha beasts, continue to harass you. Although you can take care of them, it's making progress slow.

mission.name: Daknak's Back
mission.desc: Daknak jumps out in front of you, again. However this time, he has a little trick up his sleeve...

line.text: Bahaha, so you think you can take on the mighty Daknak, do ya?

mission.name: Daknak's Strike
mission.desc: Somehow, Daknak has figured out how to use the First Order defense system. And he's keen to turn it against you!

line.text: Daknak have revenge now!

mission.name: Year 2016
mission.desc: Spellstone's 5th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's villains and get amazing rewards!

line.text: You gotta fight.
For your right.
To parrrrrty!

mission.name: Year 2017
mission.desc: Spellstone's 5th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Hi! My name is Solaron.
And I like to party!
No. You don't.
Well... you are right. But today I'll make an exception.
Let's party!

mission.name: Year 2018
mission.desc: Spellstone's 5th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titans and get amazing rewards!

line.text: C'mon! A little party never hurt anyone!
But then again... those parties didn't invite us titans!

mission.name: Year 2019
mission.desc: Spellstone's 5th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's... (not very sober) entity of evil and get amazing rewards!

line.text: I'm blue da ba dee da ba daa!
Da ba dee da ba daa, da ba dee da ba daa, da ba dee da ba daa!
Such a catchy song! Do you know I'm also kinda blue?
I think Bluefire here is drunk...
Da ba dee da ba daa!

mission.name: Year 2020
mission.desc: Spellstone's 5th Anniversary celebration has begun! Defeat this node's party titan and get amazing rewards!

line.text: Hi! Are you having a good time?
Come on, Fire, let's go party!
Da ba dee da ba daa!
... Don't mind them.
I just wanted to say something before this party gets wilder...
Yeah! WYLDER!
Ahem!
Happy 5th Anniversary, Spellstone!
Now... Let's get this party started!

mission.name: Daknak Laugh!
mission.desc: Daknak laughs as you chase after him, stopped by his small army of Goblins and Mechas. He runs to one of the glowing ley lines, slamming his sword into the dirt.

mission.name: Daknak Earthquake!
mission.desc: The ground rumbles. Higher above, the volcano gurgles lava. The magical energy condenses to where Daknak thrust his sword, causing the sword's runes to light up.

mission.name: Daknak Magic!
mission.desc: The goblins whoop and jump up and down in time to the earthquake. Daknak struggles to pull his sword out of the rocky mountainside, eventually managing but with too much force. After falling, but quickly rising, he brandishes the sword.

mission.name: Daknak Power!
mission.desc: The goblins cheer and applaude Daknak's strength. Daknak is using the ley lines to power his sword. The other goblins and mechas join him, trying to cut you down!

mission.name: Volcano Journey
mission.desc: After dealing with Daknak, you continue your journey up the volcano peak. You spy a small group of dragons.

mission.name: Return of Teroxis
mission.desc: You pass the dragons without much incident. Although a few are trying to play with you and becoming nippy, they don't seem incredibly concerned by your appearance.

line.text: Look, ahead... isn't that the talking dragon?

mission.name: Familiar Faces
mission.desc: More than just Teroxis, you see another human amongst them. The familiar girl is hanging close to the dragon, one hand upon its side. You've found Vel, in the midst of her adventures.

line.text: Friends...
Hello again!

mission.name: First Order Past
mission.desc: You and Oda tell Vel about your reason for coming to Tarragon Peak. Since she was around in the ancient past, Vel might have more information to share.

line.text: The First Order Monks... yes, they once ruled the dragons here, long ago.

mission.name: Seastone Staff's Power
mission.desc: Vel reflects on the First Order Monks. The Monks have mainly been a quiet group, coming to the continent originaly to eke out their days in peace.

line.text: Their Seastone Staff was able to combine and sever the monks' ties to the Elementals.

mission.name: Missing Staff
mission.desc: The Seastone Staff was one of the treasures used to defeat Bluefire of The Void. However, it's passed hands multiple times, and in the process Oda lost its location.

line.text: Then if we find the Seastone Staff again, we might be able to save Master Kensho!

mission.name: Kensho's Deception
mission.desc: Kensho knew more than what he was letting on at your initial meeting. Forbidden techniques can't be done with a simple snap of the fingers. He must have had some power...

line.text: If he's already combined with an Elemental, that means he's the one who has the staff, Oda.
Oh... oh no... He completely played me then, asking about the Staff when he already had it!

mission.name: Power Coil Surges
mission.desc: You and Oda are prepared to leave with your newfound information. However, Vel stops you before you get far.

line.text: One more thing... I've been sensing great power surges lately. Is that your doing?

mission.name: Titan of Titans
mission.desc: You explain to Vel your plan to master the three Titans. Viracocha should be able to house all the powers, and hopefully stand against the might of the other Titans.

line.text: Wow, a mechanical Titan... it might work.
But remember, just slamming a bunch of powers together won't suddenly make them controllable.

mission.name: Titan of Titans
mission.desc: Despite the problems it created, The Void was the controlling force of the three Titans. Without The Void, there needs to be something else that binds them together.

line.text: You'll need something else to bind them all together. Like how The Void did, just... The Void isn't an option, obviously.

mission.name: Spiritual Binding
mission.desc: The ancient dragon of Tarragon Peak has weathered hundreds of seasons. Although his speech is ineloquent, he is undoubtedly one of the wisest creatures on the continent.

line.text: Need... spirit!
Not a bad idea, friend. A tie to the spirit world would be able to control your physical mecha Titan.

mission.name: Friendly Spirit
mission.desc: Oda reflects on their advice. Spirits, especially friendly spirits, are rare creatures to come by. But there was one who helped in the past...

line.text: When we were lost in The Void, there was a friendly spirit who helped us, wasn't there?
Thanks for everything, Vel. We'll see what we can do.

mission.name: The Tale of Pumpking
mission.desc: The goblins from Goblin Rise Stronghold retell to Daknak the tragic tale of Pumpking, a king who only wanted to spread goodwill by giving children candy. However, he met a tragic end when his rivals played an unfair trick upon him.

line.text: Bahaha! Daknak laugh at silly Pumpking story!
Ooh, Boss! Be careful how many times you say that name; something bad happens if you say it three times!

mission.name: Pumpking's Appearance
mission.desc: Although the goblins warned Daknak about the power of Pumpking's name, Daknak tests his luck. He departs from the other goblins, laughing at their ghost story.

line.text: Daknak have no fear of Pumpking! Daknak say Pumpking name more times than Daknak!
Daknak say Pumpking, Pumpking, Pumpking!
D-Daknak sorry!

mission.name: More Trick Than Treat
mission.desc: The strange apparition lays something by Daknak's feet, before turning and fading into the night. The goblins return in time to see Daknak holding the item.

line.text: Ghost left... a pumpkin full of candy?
Thanks for getting us some sweet candy, Boss!
Hey, no take! That's Daknak's candy!

mission.name: Revisiting the Angel Queen
mission.desc: You and Elyse travel to Skyhaven, seeking an audience with the Angel Queen Leyla. If you are to finish the missing piece of Viracocha's transformation, you must find Samael - or more specifically, his sword Dyrnwyn, which houses a friendly spirit.

line.text: Samael? Yes, he returned here recently.
A surge of Aether energy came from beneath Skyhaven. Samael is investigating.

mission.name: Whispers of Solaron
mission.desc: Following the Angel Queen's advice, you head beneath Skyhaven's library. You recall being here earlier, when you were investigating information on the Divine and Fallen Crest Angels.

line.text: Aether energy... Solaron wasn't in Luminis, was he? He might be in Skyhaven instead.

mission.name: Secret Scriptorium
mission.desc: You find the secret passage in the scriptorium that leads deeper, into the true heart of Skyhaven. What was once Gladius Arena in the distant past has now been converted into an archive of history.

mission.name: Monster Dominance
mission.desc: Creatures crawl out from behind the bookshelves and statues. Unhappy that you disturbed their rest, they attack!

line.text: The whole place is overrun with monsters! I hope Samael is okay.

mission.name: Master Protection
mission.desc: Aether creatures block your path at every turn. Tribes you didn't even expect to be in Skyhaven are locked in Gladius Scriptorium.

line.text: Skishhhhh... protect Master Kensho!

mission.name: Samael's Assistance
mission.desc: An enemy is about to sneak attack Elyse. Right when you're about to warn her, a winged ally comes to her rescue.

line.text: Adventurer, and Elyse? I did not expect to see you here again.

mission.name: Request for Dyrnwyn
mission.desc: Elyse wastes no time in explaining your purpose in being here. Although the request is a large one, time is limited with the Titans gaining power.

line.text: Samael, I know this is a big request, but... we need to borrow your sword, Dyrnwyn.
The adventurer is the one who returned it to me, so I will not refuse. However...

mission.name: Samael's Purpose
mission.desc: Taking away Dyrnwyn would reduce Samael's own strength. He has come to Gladius Scriptorium with a very specific purpose.

line.text: I am here to stop Kensho. He and his Aether minions plan to take over Skyhaven.
I must deal with this first before I hand over my sword.

mission.name: Saving Skyhaven
mission.desc: Elyse is surprised at Samael's reasoning, but hardly adverse. Teaming up to get rid of the Aether monsters beneath Skyhaven could only benefit everyone.

line.text: Then we're here to help you, too. It would be a disaster if Kensho succeeds.

mission.name: Aether Fight
mission.desc: The group presses on. More Aether creatures block your path. Despite once calling himself proud to be Aether, Samael doesn't hesitate to cut them down.

mission.name: Samael's Choice
mission.desc: Elyse notices Samael's change. The Samael with you now is very different than the one who pursued power at The Void.

line.text: Not that I'm complaining, but why don't you support Solaron, Samael?

mission.name: Samael's Heart
mission.desc: Samael has very high standards for others, but also for himself. After nearly being taken over by The Void, he has since re-evaluated his ideals.

line.text: I've already seen where that path leads... I will not accept his methods.
There are better ways to show Aether's strength than mind control.

mission.name: Seastone Staff Power
mission.desc: Kensho wields the legendary Seastone Staff. Once used to separate The Void from corrupted souls, he instead uses it now to siphon Elementals into his being.

mission.name: Kensho's Aether
mission.desc: Solaron's presence looms heavily through the air. The weight of Aether eyes bore into you and Kensho, judging your being. Monsters gather at Kensho's bidding, throwing themselves against your might.

mission.name: Arena Fighting
mission.desc: Gladius may have been repurposed as a Scriptorium, but you still remember the last time you saw it as the Arena. You can feel the spirits of the past alongside you, the image of Batara helping you fight against the Aether creatures.

mission.name: Continued Conclusion
mission.desc: With a mighty blow you defeat Kensho. The magic keeping together his Elemental form vanishes, and you grab the Seastone Staff. Solaron unleashes a mighty roar, the ceiling rumbling ominously...

mission.name: Aether Home
mission.desc: Aether creatures seem to be expecting your every turn. Fighting comes and goes in waves. From one fierce fight you go to eerie peace...

line.text: I didn't expect this many enemies beneath Skyhaven.
I pursued Kensho down here, however... this might be a trap.

mission.name: Fighting Further Monsters
mission.desc: Aether monsters spring out to attack! They have you and the group surrounded. And you sense a dense presence nearby...

mission.name: Powerful Aether
mission.desc: After fighting off a portion of the creatures, a loud voice rings throughout Gladius Scriptorium. Your group freezes, a powerful presence drawing near.

line.text: Who dare trespass upon my domain?

mission.name: Aether Leader Showdown
mission.desc: Even worse, with Solaron is another powerful enemy. It seems the three of you have stumbled onto Solaron's main domain.

line.text: Ho ho... so the fallen Aether leader seeks an audience with Lord Solaron.

mission.name: Samael's Quarrel
mission.desc: Despite the poor odds, Samael shows no fear. He cuts straight to the reason why he's come to Gladius Scriptorium.

line.text: My quarrel isn't with Solaron. My fight is with YOU, Kensho.

mission.name: For Oda
mission.desc: Elyse backs up Samael's bold claim. Although Oda isn't present, Elyse knows her friend and history very well.

line.text: Hand over the Seastone Staff. It rightfully belongs to Oda.

mission.name: Solaron's Disapproval
mission.desc: The Aether have strict standards which define them. Solaron is apalled to hear the accusation against Kensho.

line.text: You claim that the Hand of Solaron is a thief? Kensho... what have you done?

mission.name: Kensho Keepsake
mission.desc: Although you aren't strong enough yet to face Solaron, Kensho is a different matter. Kensho pleads to Solaron to reconsider his initial anger.

line.text: They slander me, Lord Solaron. As a Keeper, the Seastone Staff is rightfully mine!

mission.name: Keeper Keepsake
mission.desc: Elyse won't have any of Kensho's word tricks. If ownership is decided by the First Order Keepers, then Oda has just as much a right as Kensho.

line.text: Oda is a Keeper too, and you took it from him!

mission.name: Aether Honor
mission.desc: Solaron weighs the words of your group against Kensho's. As an embodiment of Aether, pride and honor run deep within Solaron.

line.text: This displeases me. Fight for your right, Kensho.
The victor shall walk with the Staff in their possession.

mission.name: Ghosts of the Past
mission.desc: Kensho gathers the Aether creatures to him. Ghosts of the Crimsonwings appear and gather to help him.

mission.name: Against Kensho
mission.desc: Kensho is still a normal human, albeit one fused with the Elementals. For Oda's sake you prepare to fight, win back the Seastone Staff, and get Samael's sword Dyrnwyn!

line.text: Very well. I don't need Solaron to defeat you!

mission.name: Continue from Gladius
mission.desc: After defeating Kensho, you take the Seastone Staff and flee Gladius Scriptorium. Samael grabs the unconscious Kensho, and Elyse follows closely behind. Although you encounter some resistance, Solaron seems to be allowing you to leave.

line.text: That was easier than I expected. Solaron held up the bargain.
But what do we do with... -him-?

mission.name: Oda's Rightful Staff
mission.desc: Oda has been waiting for you anxiously, keeping watch over Skyhaven. As he notices you emerging from the underground tunnel, he runs up to greet you.

line.text: Adventurer, and Elyse! You made it back!
Here, Oda. This Seastone Staff belongs to you.

mission.name: Seastone Staff Severance
mission.desc: Oda now has the Seastone Staff. He runs his hand over it, before turning to Kensho. He points it towards the First Order Monk.

line.text: Then the first thing I'll do as Keeper...
Is separate the Elementals controlling Kensho's mind!

mission.name: Elemental Exorcism
mission.desc: The Seastone Staff glows as Oda activates its power. Kensho's body begins to glow in Aether fire. After a moment, wind and water Elementals fly out of his body, leaving behind the monk.

line.text: The exorcised Elementals have left his body.
But now they're after us! Look out!

mission.name: Purified Monk
mission.desc: You fight off the creatures that emerged from Kensho's body. Eventually they dissipate, and the First Order Monk awakens. Oda looks to him hopefully.

line.text: Ehh... Wha? Oda?
Master Kensho! Thank goodness, you're back to your normal self.

mission.name: Right Mind
mission.desc: Kensho rises shakily to his feet. He looks around bewildered, but doesn't show the earlier hostility he displayed just moments before. Oda cries and hugs him.

line.text: Is it that simple? Can we really trust him?
You're one to talk...

mission.name: Mind Restored
mission.desc: Kensho hesitantly returns the hug, patting Oda on the back. But then he gasps, pulling away and looking up frantically to the rest of the group.

line.text: Thank you, Oda. I meant to master the Elementals, but they mastered me!
Hold on.... this isn't time for celebration. We're in danger!

mission.name: Solaron's Assault
mission.desc: Kensho looks behind you towards the underground tunnel. As if in response, the earth starts to rumble. Aether creatures fly out, soaring into the heights of Skyhaven!

line.text: Solaron... He's been planning to take over Skyhaven.
We thought you were the one plotting, but Solaron is a bigger problem than what Skyhaven can handle.

mission.name: Samael's Concern
mission.desc: For the first time you can remember, Samael looks visibly worried at the stream of creatures emerging from the underground tunnel. He and Oda run off to help the rest of Skyhaven.

line.text: I must go evacuate the Angel Queen!
Wait, it's not safe. I'll come with you.

mission.name: Stopping Solaron
mission.desc: Elyse is about to follow them, but Kensho places a hand on her shoulder. The group has to split up to handle two different responsibilities...

line.text: Then we should-
We must stop Solaron.
But how?! Viracocha isn't ready yet!

mission.name: Wyld Power Coil Location
mission.desc: Kensho watches the creatures begin to cause havoc across Skyhaven. You and Elyse prepare to fight off the ones approaching, but there's far too many to properly protect the entire town.

line.text: Solaron will feed on all the Aether energy here. If we activate the Wyld Power Coil, it will tip the energies away from his preference.
The Wyld Power Coil is here? How?

mission.name: Power Coil Mystery
mission.desc: Even though Skyhaven has been a haven for Aether, which no doubt has attracted Solaron's attention, Kensho claims a Wyld Power Coil exists here. Perhaps the answer lies with the Fallen and Divine Crests, but there's no time to investigate.

line.text: Hoho... another question for another time. What matters is activating it.

mission.name: Two Old Men Reunited
mission.desc: Malchior has dragged Tarian out of the small shack. The two friends catch up on what they've missed over the last few months, as Malchior has been traveling on the airship.

line.text: Malchior, why did you call me out here?
It's simple, my friend... I require your skills!

mission.name: World's Center Dangers
mission.desc: Malchior takes Tarian past the rocky path, into the snowy forest. They pass many diseased, rotted trees; monsters and undead lurking in their shadows.

line.text: There is an enemy that only you can fell...
Then this must be serious, if you're asking me over your adventurer friend.

mission.name: The Biggest Tree
mission.desc: Malchior stops at a large tree, one of the few that hasn't been tainted by the disease. It grows strong and tall, evergreen pine needles sticking out from its branches.

line.text: Right here! This gigantic pine tree!-

mission.name: Ax of the Lich Lord
mission.desc: Tarian stops cold. He has humored many of Malchior's outlandish requests in the past, but he cannot figure out his motivation behind this one.

line.text: Malchior, my ax is meant for cleaving bone, not chopping firewood!

mission.name: Holiday Presents
mission.desc: Malchior begs Tarian to reconsider his earlier choice. The tree is meant for others who have never seen such things, not for one of Malchior's experiments.

line.text: But think of the Chaos children back in Karthos, and how they'd decorate this big tree!
Fine, I'll do it, but don't you dare tell anyone about this. I have a reputation to uphold.

mission.name: Seed
mission.desc: When the world was nothing but a barren wastleand, seed was scattered across the lands. Some fell on dry soil, others drowned in the ocean, but some fell on fertile soil.

mission.name: Sprout
mission.desc: The promise of life budded from the seeds that fell on fertile soil. Green life blossomed from the barren earth; the promise of a greater future, stretching towards the sunlight.

mission.name: Shrub
mission.desc: The bud matured to a young sapling. Surviving the hardships of the torrential rain and the scorching sunlight, between the two elements did the shrub take form.

mission.name: Tree
mission.desc: That is Wyld. The ability to adapt and change, yet remain true to one's roots. Between the extremes of the other elements and factions, the Wyld persevere; a stable force in an unstable world. And this memory, this data, will be sent to the Titan Aspirer, Viracocha.

mission.name: Wyld Apperance
mission.desc: Hoping to avert an inevitable disaster with Solaron's attack, you have little choice but to accept Kensho's proposition. He rushes you towards the Wyld Power Coil, a great statue atop a pillar.

line.text: This is the last Power Coil we need to activate for Viracocha!
Um... maybe you should try touching it.

mission.name: Third Power Coil
mission.desc: You clear out the Aether creatures that have tried attacking the tower. Once they're gone, the tower opens up, a light taking form...

line.text: Commencing initialization welcome sequence. Greetings, sentients.

mission.name: Wyld Simulation
mission.desc: It's the same as the other Power Coils. Kensho was right; there really is a Wyld Power Coil in Skyhaven. All that's left is to simulate Wyld.

line.text: I am an AI designed to simulate Wyld.
Provide the necessary answers to automate Wyld attunement process.

mission.name: Wyld Essence
mission.desc: The construct begins with a similar question as the others. To become and awaken Wyld, it must first understand its true nature.

line.text: What element embodies Wyld?
Wyld is... nature. The trees, earth, grass - all of Mother Nature's Bounty.

mission.name: Wyld Value
mission.desc: Elyse has spent most of her time in Elaria, learning from the Ranger's camp along with the researchers. When it comes to Wyld attunement, she's one of the best allies to answer the Power Coil's questions.

line.text: What is the most important of these three: growth, power, or peace?
It's growth. The Wyld... learn and adapt. In the harshest of deserts, to the lushest of forests, they can survive anywhere.

mission.name: Wyld Manifestation
mission.desc: The Wyld Power Coil lets out a whirring noise. Like the others, it has prepared a final test. Wyld creatures awaken at its call, preparing to fight you.

line.text: Attunement complete.
Fight the manifestation you created and I will send its memory bank to the Master.

mission.name: Solaron's Recognition
mission.desc: With the fight complete, the Wyld manifestation disappears. A green light appears from it like a becaon, racing up to the sky. You feel Solaron's voice rumble in response...

line.text: What is this... energy coming from the tower?

mission.name: Solaron's Rejection
mission.desc: The skies tint green with the power of the Wyld energy. Solaron's voice shakes the skies like thunder, booming out for everyone to hear.

line.text: Disgusting Angels... rejecting not only me, but the very core of your soul!
You are worthless to me.

mission.name: Saving Skyhaven
mission.desc: The creatures that were attacking Skyhaven stop at the sound of Solaron's voice. Abruptly they cease their attacks, fleeing back to the underground tunnel.

mission.name: Temporary Peace
mission.desc: Elyse sighs as the creatures continue to flee. Kensho, who has been watching you and Elyse fiddle with the Wyld Power Coil, offers you some encouragement.

line.text: Phew.... that was a close one.
Good job, young one. Solaron has lost interest in Skyhaven for now, but he might try to expand in the future.

mission.name: Truce
mission.desc: Although the danger has passed from Skyhaven for the time being, Solaron has simply returned to Gladius Scriptorium. It's just a matter of time before he decides to take over more land and expand his domain, regardless of the Power Coil's influence.

line.text: Then we have to act quickly.

mission.name: Return to Viracocha
mission.desc: Finally, you have activated all the Power Coils. However, the largest unknown factor of Viracocha still remains. You must prepare for the worst and head out to meet him, so you can defeat the Titans!

line.text: Now that we have the sword Dyrnwyn, and activated the last Power Coil, let's go see Viracocha!
